loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 32 years old and married with three children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and earns additional income from selling school supplies and gasoline.

Mary Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is 39 years old, married and has four children. He recycles scrap metals to make energy saving cookers, feeders and metallic boxes.  He has been in the business since 1998. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.
Danson hopes to grow his profits margins in the future. He has requested 60,000 KES to buy scrap metals for recycling.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals for recycling

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is 39 years old, married with two children who are in school. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been operating this business for two years and has employed one person. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved on her saving culture through the seminars she attended. Millicent dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Mme Fatoumata âgée de 28 ans habite à environ 1 km de l’Institution, mariée et mère de 2 filles, elle s’active dans le commerce depuis 2 ans. Elle a loué une cantine à 17 500 f par mois  non loin de sa maison et elle y vend des produits cosmétiques. Avec le commerce elle aide son mari aux besoins familiaux, elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 f pour acheter des parfums, des habits pour enfants, des chaussures pour adultes et enfants afin de satisfaire la demande et générer plus de bénéfices. Ce qui lui permettra d’épauler son mari et en même temps d’épargner pour elle. Elle souhaite un jour avoir une grande boutique et vendre en gros.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata, aged 28, lives about 1 km from the microfinance institution. She is married and the mother of two girls, and she has been active in commerce for two years. She has leased a stall at 17,500 francs per month not far from her house. She sells cosmetic products there. With her business, she helps her husband in meeting family needs. 

She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to purchase perfumes, children's clothing, and shoes for adults and children in order to satisfy the demand and generate more profit. This will enable her to support her husband and, at the same time, to save money for herself. She would like to have a large store one day and to sell in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing to resell

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 63 years old and is married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them. Eugenia has run a general store (a sari-sari store) in the Philippines for the past three years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, spices, soap, canned goods, etc. 

Eugenia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 51 years old and is married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store (a sari-sari store) in the Philippines for the past 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling vegetables.

Julieta has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. Julieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Justina works hard to support her family. She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from planting seaweed. 

Justina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing/fish vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed has been in his barber shop for about two years. He is 28 and married, without any children. He works very hard to provide for her wife whom he loves very much. They rent the house they live in but they hope to own their house soon.

While Mohamed is busy in his barber shop, his wife works in their vegetable stall. This way they have not lacked any basic needs. Due to the increasing number of customers, he has seen the need to increase the number of electric razors so that customers do not have to wait for long. Mohamed is taking out this loan in order to purchase electric razors. At his barber shop, he is assisted by a friend and plans to employ his cousin once he has bought the new razors.

loans.use: to purchase electric razors

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 30 years old and is married with five children who are in school. She sells used clothes to earn a living. 

Teresia has engaged in this business for twenty years. Becoming a client of Faulu Kenya, Teresia has learned how to manage her business through training on business management skills. She dreams of importing clothes for sale in the future. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy shorts, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy shorts, blouses, and skirts to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 40 years old and has six children. Gemma is married and four of her children are in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy other fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gemma has been farming vegetables for eight years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy other fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: With a previous loan, Joel was able to buy rice, sugar, cooking fat and tea leaves for his shop. This helped him improve his business and with the additional income, he paid school fees for his children. He is requesting for another loan of 30,000 KES to add more stock of rice, sugar, cooking fat and tea leaves.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking fat, and tea leaves

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 36 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Melanie has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, milk, noodles, coffee, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gpf Bokk Khool F Y L Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Gpf bokk khool F Y L" se compose de 18 femmes (les enfants ne font pas partis). Les femmes cultivent un champs collectif de mil derrière leur village.Elles vendent leur récolte et se partagent les bénéfices.Ce qui leur permet de subvenir à leurs besoins et à ceux de leurs familles respectives.Le chef de groupe ( en blanc , au milieu) est une mère de famille qui compte sept enfants.Elles pratique une activité secondaire de vente de denrées de première nécessité.Le groupement sollicite un pret de 990000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
texts.en:
The group "Gpf bokk khool F Y L" comprises eighteen women (not including the children). The women are cultivating a collective field of millet behind their village. They sell their harvest and share in the profits. This enables them to meet their needs and those of their respective families.

The head of the group (in white in the middle of the photo) is a mother who has seven children. She has a second business selling essential grocery items. The group is requesting a loan of 990,000 francs to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 45 años de edad, el está casado y tiene 2 hijos.
José se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora con muchas ideas emprendedoras, cuenta con una despensa que le ayuda a generar ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mayor mercaderías de primera necesidad para satisfacer la demanda de la comunidad que con eso también aumentarían sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Jose is 45 years old. He is married and has 2 children.

José is known for being a hardworking person with many entrepreneurial ideas. He has a grocery store which helps him generate income to support his family.

He is applying for the loan to buy more basic products to stock his store in order to satisfy the demands of the community,  and with this he will also increase his income.

loans.use: to buy products such as milk, sugar, and baked goods for his store.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 48 years old and is married with one child who is in school. Lilia works very hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for the past five years where she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, soap, spices, etc. 

Lilia has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 42 years old and is married with three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Brigida has been raising livestock for 15 years and earns additional income from selling firewood.

Brigida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a hard-working 30-year-old businessman who runs a motorbike transport business for a living. He operates his business in a competitive environment with reliable customers. Richard has been engaged in this business for three years. 

His business has grown since he became a client of Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills. Richard dreams of expanding his business and employing people in the future. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to service his motorbike.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann operates a grocery store to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her to start a new business selling charcoal. This helped her business to improve and with the income she generated, she was able to support her family. Ann is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy tomatoes, carrots, bananas and cereals to sell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, carrots, bananas and cereals.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El comité San Ramón esta compuesto por 12 integrantes entre ellas todas mujeres que realizan actividades diversas. La mayoría se dedica a la venta ya sea de ropas o productos de consumo de la canasta básica familiar como harina, arroz, sal, carnes, verduras y bebidas gasificadas.
Una de las integrantes, la Señora Claudia se dedica a las ventas de ropa de todo tipo como remeras, camisas, pantalones, etc. Con el crédito la señora desea comprar mayor cantidad de ropas para luego venderlas y así aumentar la clientela y el ingreso.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de remeras, pantalones, polleras, etc.
texts.en:
The San Ramon committee consists of twelve female members who make a living in a variety of ways.  The majority of them are in the business of clothes or basic consumer products such as flour, rice, salt, meats, vegetables, and carbonated beverages.  

One of the member, Claudia, makes a living selling typical clothing like shirts, pants, jackets, etc.  With this loan Claudia hopes to purchase her items in larger quantities so that she can increase her customer base and thus her income.  She seeks the loan to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is from Poblacion 4, Clarin. She is 35 years old. Juliet is married and has two children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a food vending business. Juliet has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC. Juliet is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 62 years old and has five children. Isabelita is married and has three children who are in school.

Isabelita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Isabelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Isabelita has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to her business. 

In the future, Isabelita would like to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 56 years old and has four children. Justina is married and one of her children is in school.

Justina is in the agricultural business raising vegetables in the Philippines. Justina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Justina has been farming vegetables for five years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Justina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 41 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Remedios is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Remedios has been raising pigs for eight years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 36-year-old fish vendor from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.
Judith joined CEVI to obtain the financial services offered by the organization. As of now, she is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional fish to sell to the people in her locality. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers, thus augmenting her income. 
 
Judith hopes to expand her business in the future and make it a success so that it will generate more revenue to use for the school expense of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. She is 48 years old and relies on hog raising for an income. She would like to make a success out of her business and she plans to improve it and make it more profitable. Her business has been in existence for five years now. She is asking for a loan to buy quality feed for her hogs to fatten them. Once her hogs are healthy, she will be able to sell them at a good price, giving her a better return on her investment. 

Her income will be for her family's daily consumption, savings and reinvestment in the same business. 

In the future, Josephine wants to make her barn bigger to accommodate more hogs to raise so she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy quality feed for her pigs

loans.name: Bahat

texts.en: Mr. Bahat is 42 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar city. His wife helps in her husband's business. His seven-year-old son goes to a secondary school. They bought a home apartment with three rooms with a mortgage. Mr. Bahat has been selling mobile phones that he imports from Hong Kong since 2006. He rents a counter in the biggest mobile trading center of Ulaanbaatar.  He also provides a mobile phone repair service. Now he decided to buy a hybrid car to deliver his products and to use for his private needs. The hybrid car costs 8,300,000 MNT. He would like to pay 2,490,000 MNT from his income and he is requesting a 5,810,000 MNT loan to pay for the rest. He is an honest and humble man.

loans.use: To pay the rest of the cost of a hybrid car

loans.name: Joceplyn

texts.en:
Joceplyn is 34 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. Joceplyn has been in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines for the past 10 years and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Joceplyn has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, aged 47, is married with three children and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and manages coconut production to earn a living. Ana has been doing this for 15 years and every month she earns 6,000 PHP from this work. 

Ana has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Ana hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for the past eight years.

Jessica has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janet works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing. Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. Janet hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 19 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Leah dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Gina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. 

Gina has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business so she can support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 43 years old, is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has had a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines for the past 10 years. 

Lilia has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en:
Zadock is 35 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, he repairs broken metallic items such as stoves, cans and cooking pans. He uses scrap metal to repair the items. He has been in the business since 2000. With the income from his business, he is able to provide for his family and pay school fees for his children.

Zadock hopes to grow his business in the future. He needs a loan of 65,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal to repair broken items.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, es soltera y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en una casa alquilada ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como comerciante ya que se dedica a la venta de verduras cerca de un mercado trabajando por más de diez horas al día ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su mercadería ya que desea comprar verduras por mayor para mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Victoria es adquirir una casa en anticrético para ahorrar en alquileres y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Victoria is single, and has a school-aged son. She lives in a rented house, occupying two rooms with adobe walls and earth floor. The house is located in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz.

Currently she works as a merchant; selling vegetables near a market, working for more than 10 hours a day, as she is the only one who covers her family's expenses for food, education, and payment of basic services. 

She needs the loan to increase her merchandise, as she wishes to buy vegetables at wholesale in order to improve her income. 

Victoria's dream is to acquire a home on the basis of "anticrético" (returnable lump sum paid at beginning of rental contract, in lieu of monthly payments) to save on rent and improve her quality of life. 

It is the first time she has applied for a loan from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale for her business selling vegetables at retail.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Merlyn has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari) store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal-care products, home-use products and beverages. She had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 37 years old. Ailyn is married and has three children. To make a living, she manages a fish vending business. She has been in her business for 10 years and earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Ailyn joined GDMPC. Ailyn is requesting a loan of 18,400 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet’s married and has no children yet. Because the income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, and because she wanted to keep herself busy, Jane decided to find a way to contribute economically to her home to provide a better quality of life for herself and her husband, whom she loves most.

She got her working capital from her husband to open a food-selling business, selling snacks on a retail basis and also, at times, through door-to-door sales. Getting ahead with the business has been very difficult because of the little capital she has compared to the growing demand from the customers, which is why she’s looking for a loan to buy ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder and cooking oil.

In this way, she will be able to gradually stock her store so that her customers can get good service there. Her greatest dream is to succeed with the store so that, thanks to it, she can continue offering her home a better quality of life and better opportunities for economic progress.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bilimhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bilimhan is 46 years old and lives with his wife and his children in an old, small house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife is named Barshagul, and she helps his organic vegetables business. His 23-year-old daughter is a college student. His 10-year-old daughter and 7-year-old son are secondary students. 

He started his own organic vegetables and fruits trade business in 1998. He plants organic potatoes, cucumber, tomatoes and carrots. Today, Mr.Bilimhan has been well-experienced in the organic vegetable trade business, and his fellow local residents appreciate him as a hardworking man. His business is sustainable, and he has many regular customers and suppliers. He is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase seeds for his organic vegetables trade business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for his organic vegetables business.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is 28 years old. He is married with 2 dependents. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He provides transport vehicle services for a living. Allan earns 4,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Allan joined GDMPC. He asked for a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Allan plans to improve the general living conditions of the his family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is borrowing his third loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase assorted food items and serving utensils. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further and repay his loan. He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables, and cereals

loans.name: Demphana

texts.en: Demphana is 35 years old. She is from Patrocinio, Cortes, Bohol. She is married with two children who are 8 and 9 years old. She wants to help her husband, who works as a welder, in supporting their family. That is the reason why she is currently runs her sari-sari business. In her store, she sell items like soft drinks, liquor, cigarettes, and basic household needs, like seasoning and noodles. She also sells prepaid loads. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like soft drinks, chips, cigarettes, seasoning, and toiletries. A well-stocked store will attract more customers. Her income will be for a healthy diet for her children and school fees.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft drinks, chips, cigarettes, seasoning, and toiletries

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 42-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has six children who are still in school. Josefina has run a sari-sari, or convenience store, in their place for five years now. This is the source of her income. 

Josefina lacks capital for the expansion of her business. As of now, she is asking for a loan worth 10,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, and snack foods. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers, thus allowing her to increase her sales and profit.

Josefina dreams of improving her business. Moreover, she wants to earn more so that she can support her children in school.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, and snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin his coursework in automobile mechanics.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de chocolates y tambien venta de artesania,la socia elabora los chocolates y los vende a sus amigos y familiares,la socia tambien vende artesania como panatalones,gorros,casacas y mantas,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender chocolates.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chocolate,leche y azucar al por mayor para que elabore los chocolates.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Doris continues working in her business of making chocolates and selling crafts. She makes the chocolates and sells them to her friends and family members. She also sells craft items such as pants, knitted hats, sweaters, and shawls. She has been working in this business for 5 years. Her dream is to have a store where she could sell her chocolates. She is requesting the loan to buy chocolate, milk, and sugar at wholesale price for making her chocolates. 

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy chocolate, milk, and sugar at wholesale price

loans.name: Anna Ruby

texts.en: Anna Ruby is from Labuyo, Tangub City. She is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. Anna Ruby owns and operates a business providing dress-making services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Anna Ruby joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her dressmaking services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide her dressmaking services.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is from Mantic, Tangub City. She is 42 years old. She is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Esterlita cultivates flowers for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Esterlita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,600 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a widow with 4 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Labuyo, Tangub City. Lydia owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns 7,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Lydia has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. In the future, Lydia's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 25 years old and lives in a small village of Kareli district. She is married and has two children (4 and 6 years old), a mother-in-law and the grandmother of her husband at home. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land where maize, cabbage and haricot are grown. 

Madona is also involved in the animal husbandry business. She owns a milking cow and a calf. Madona milks the cow every day and produces cheese. The cheese is sold locally. Madona is a very hard-working woman, with a great desire to get ahead. She requested a loan to purchase calves. She will raise them and will be able to get milk after a year. Madona will produce cheese and other dairy products and sell locally. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, she will be able to realize her dream of giving her family a better quality of life

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Jeanne Marie

texts.fr: jeanne est une femme de 44 ans mariée, commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 10 ans ou elle  commercialises les vivres (oignons, obergines, tomates...) en fonction des saisons. Elle a déjà une bonne connaissance de ses fournissuers et surtout de ses clients grace à sa longue expérience dans ce domaine. cette activité lui permet d'aider son époux à résoudre certaines besoins quotidiens. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant des filets d'oignons et des obergines. Ceci augmnetera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. le bénefice que lui apportera ce crédit sera réinveesti en partie dans son activité pour l'étendre et le reste lui permettra de subvenir à leurs besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Jeanne, a 44-year-old married woman, has been a shopkeeper in the capital city's market for ten years. She sells food products (onions, eggplants, tomatoes) depending on the season.

She knows her suppliers and, above all, her customers very well thanks to her long experience in this area.

This business allows her to help her husband take care of their daily needs.

She is asking for this credit to increase her stock of merchandise by buying onions and eggplants. This will increase her sales and thus her profit margin. The income from this loan will be partly reinvested to expand the business. The rest will allow her to meet her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy eggplants and onions

loans.name: Cosme Olivio

texts.es:
Cosme Olivio tiene 61 años, Es casado vive con la esposa tiene tres hijos pero todos son casados, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Cosme Olivio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, cebolla, arroz. Las compras de los productos lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para compra de semillas, abonos, urea, insecticidas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos cómo el cogollero. El  sueño es comprar una finca y una casa.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte y disfrutar de las festividades del recinto en compañia de la familia.
texts.en:
Cosme Olivio, age 60, is married and lives with his wife. He has three children, but all of them are married. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

The members of the “Divino Niño” (Divine Child) Communal Bank live in the Estero Lindo precinct. The members of this bank devote themselves to growing short cycle corn and rice.

Cosme devotes himself to growing corn, cacao, onions and rice. He buys the products in Ventanas. 

He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and insecticides. The support of the loan will help him to financially supply his necessities. 

He faces challenges like pest infestation by the tobacco budworm. 

His dream is to buy a finca and a house. 

In his free time he likes to do sports and to enjoy precinct holidays with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and insecticides.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир – из Хуста, Западная Украина. Он зарабатывает на жизнь торговлей подростковой одеждой и мужским бельем на местном рынке. Владимир арендует контейнеры для торговли, так как своего торгового места у него пока нет. В этой сфере работает уже 7 лет.  

Владимир надеется за счет кредита от КИВА в размере 5 000 гривен приобрести дополнительную партию одежды для подростков перед началом нового учебного года в сентябре. Владимир хотел бы больше расширить бизнес со временем, чтобы помогать дочке, которая живет в Киеве, а также улучшить условия проживания своей семьи. Владимир умеет быть настойчивым и выстоять в трудные времена, которых у него в бизнесе было немало, поэтому он уже добился неплохих успехов и продолжает стремиться к всё большим свершениям.
texts.en:
Vladimir is from Khoust, Western Ukraine. He earns a living by selling junior clothing and men's underwear at a local market. Vladimir rents market stalls as he does not have his own yet. He's been working in this area for 5 years.

Vladimir hopes to use a 5,000-UAH loan from Kiva to purchase an additional batch of junior clothing before the start of the new school year in September. He would eventually like to expand his operations in order to help his daughter, who lives in Kiev, and to improve his family's living conditions. Vladimir knows how to be persistent and persevere in difficult times, which he has often encountered in his business. This has allowed him to be quite successful with his business, and he keeps striving for further achievements.

loans.use: to purchase an additional batch of junior clothing before the start of the new school year in September

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, aged twenty-nine, lives in Buchanan with her husband and three children, aged between five and fourteen years old. She stopped her education in the 7th grade, and her husband is a business man. For the past fifteen years she has been selling raw fish in the market. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase cartons of fish to improve the business and increase her income. This will enable her to help her husband with the home expenses. Her dream in the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of fish.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christiana, 33, lives in Buchanan with her husband and six children aged five to fifteen years old. She has been selling soft drinks, bath soap, batteries, toothpaste and other item for the past ten years. She has learnt to sell from her mother, and she loves this kind of business because she makes profits every day. With the profits, she buys more goods so as to increase her sales and helps her husband with family expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more batteries, bath soap, toothpaste and soft drinks. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more batteries, bath soap, toothpaste and soft drinks.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is thirty-two and the mother of three children, aged 15, and 4 months old. She is married, and lives in Buchanan with her husband, who is a security guard. She learnt to sell from her mother. She is proud of her business because she feels independent. She has been involved in fish-selling for the past eight years. She sells raw and dry fish in the community market. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of fish to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fish.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al ngeocio de restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,ella prepara pollo al horno,sopas y estofado de pollo,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este ngeocio,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar pasteles y tortas,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia soliciat el credito para comprar productos de cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria continues to work in the restaurant business. She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She prepares traditional Peruvian food such as “pollo al horno”, “sopas” and “estofado de pollo”. Maria has been running her restaurant for seven years. 

In her free time she likes to bake cakes. 

Her dream is to expend her business. She is asking for this loan to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meet and vegetables. 

She is happy about the loan and she promises to fulfill the payment of all installments.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meet and vegetables.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience, 29, is a mother of three children.  She is married and lives in Buchanan.  Her children are between the ages of 3 and 11 years.  

For the past four years, Patience has been selling used clothes in the market.  She sell ladies' blouses and skirts.  She is proud of her business because she is able to contribute to the income of her family.  She makes a profit when she sells clothes.  She uses these profits to buy more goods to improve the business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru:
Махмадшариф житель города Сарбанд. Он 29-летний женатый молодой человек. У него двое детей. Его дети маленькие. 
Махмадшариф предоставляет услугу. Он арендует небольшое помещение, где открыл фотосалон. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Также Махмадшариф занимается видеомонтажом. Он просит кредит для приобретения нового оборудования и покупки хорошего фотоаппарата.
texts.en:
Mahmadsharif lives in the city of Sarband. He is a 29-year-old married young man, and has two small children.

Mahmadsharif is a service provider. He rents a small office space, where he has opened a photo studio. He has been active in this sector for six years, and also does video editing. Mahmadsharif has requested this loan to buy new equipment and a good camera.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and a good camera

loans.name: Deemar

texts.en:
Deemar, 40, is married and lives in Buchanan with her family.  Her children are between the ages of 9 and 33 years.  Only two of her children stay with her at home; one of them is independent.  Her children are not in school because she lacks the financial support to send them.  

Deemar has been selling used clothes for the past ten years.  She sells both boys' and girls' clothing.  With the profits she buys more goods to improve the business and attend to the needs of her family.  She has requested a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business.  Her future plan is to educated her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Deh-Nien

texts.en:
Deh-Nien, 39, has been working very hard for the past twenty years to meet the needs of her children.  She stopped her education in the seventh grade and now lives in Buchanan with her husband and five children, who are aged 9 to 15 years.

Deh-Nien's husband is a driver.  Deh-Nien, herself, learnt how to sell from her aunt.  She sells pepper, rice, palm oil, sardines and other items.  With the profit, generated from the business, she buys more goods to improve her business.  She has requested a loan to purchased more pepper, rice, sardines and palm oil for the business.  Her future plan is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, sardines and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Elias

texts.es:
CARLOS TIENE 34 AÑOS ES CASADO VIVE EN VENTANAS VIVE CON LA ESPOSA Y CON LOS HIJOS.

EL SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA SIEMBRA MAIZ EN TERRENOS PROPIOS, EL DINERO LO VA A EMPLAR EN ABONOS, FERTILIZANTES PARA EL MAIZ, EL DINERO LE AYUDADO A CRECER EL NEGOCIO, EL SUEÑO DE CARLOS ES COMPARAR MAS TERRENOS Y SEGUIR SEMBRANDO ADEMAS LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR UN VEHICULO PARA EL TRABAJO.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA A PASAR EN EL CAMPO,
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old, married and lives in Ventanas. He lives with his wife and their children. 

He is making a living by growing corn on his own land. He will use the money to buy corn fertilizers. The money will help him grow his business. Carlos dream is to buy more land and to continue planting. Furthermore, he would like to buy a vehicle for his work. 

He likes to spend his free time in the fields.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizers.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa, 46 years old, is married with two children, aged 27 to 30 years. Her husband is a contractor and all of them stay at Buchanan, only one of the children is in school.  For the past fifteen years, she has been selling lappers (traditional African dress for women) in the market, in order to meet the needs of her children. With the profit, she will buy more goods to improve the business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappers for the business.  Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers for the business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia lives in Buchanan. She is married with three children that are between the ages of 10 and 20. Her husband is a machine operator. Only two of the children live with her, and they are not at school because of lack of financial support. She has been involved in selling used clothing for the past nine years. She sells men trousers, ladies blouses, and ladies skirts. She is proud of her business because, with the profit she buys more goods, and uses some for feeding the family.

She has requested this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old. He lives in the Ganta area and is married with 3 children aged 5 to 15. They all live at home and attend school. For the past 10 years he has been running a general shop. David has requested this loan to purchase more batteries, soap, rice, toothpaste, etc, in order to turn his business into a bigger one. 

The problem he’s faced with is his small amount of capital. He started this business by selling for his oldest brother on a table in the market and learnt how to do this from friends. What he like about this business is that he makes new friends and meets people each and every day; it makes him proud to have money in his home every day. In future he wants to open another shop near the present shop.

loans.use: to purchase more batteries, soap, rice and toothpaste in order to turn his business into a bigger one.

loans.name: Bandu

texts.en:
Bandu lives in the Ganta area. She is 36 years old, and has three children between four and ten years old who are in school and live at home. She stopped her education in the 4th grade. She is married and her husband is a businessman.

For the past five years she has been running a shop where she sells rice in bags. She started this business with money that she received from her husband. One problem she faces is that sometimes there are no customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice in bags to attract her customers. Her plan is to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more rice in bags to attract her customers.

loans.name: Ariel Alexander

texts.es:
ARIEL TIENE 20 AÑOS ES SOLTERO VIVE CON LOS PADRES NO TIENE HIJOS VIVE EN VENTANAS.

ARIEL ES CHOFER PERO EL DINERO NECESITA PARA LA COMPRAR DE ROPA YA QUE SE VA INICIAR EN EL NEGOCIOS DE VENTA DE ROPA EN SU LOCALIDAD EL DINERO LE AYUDADO HA INVERTIR EN EL NEGOCIOS.

ARIEL SUEÑA CON TENER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO Y AYUDAR ASI A LOS PADRES,  EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA PAR TRABAJAR EN UN TAZIS COMO CHOFER.
texts.en:
Ariel is 20 years old, single and living with his parents. He has no children and he lives in Ventanas.

Ariel is a driver, but the loan is needed to buy clothes since he is starting in the business of clothing sales in his area.  The funds have helped him invest in the business.

Ariel dreams of having his own business and thus help his parents. In his spare time he makes a living as a taxi driver.

loans.use: to start in the business of clothing sales

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia atiende su tienda de abarrotes desde las 2:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio de tienda de abarrotes,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para su tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working as a teacher from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.  She also works in a grocery store business where she sells necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She tends her grocery store from 2:00 p.m. until 10:00 p.m. and has had this business for seven years.  Her dream is to expand the business.

The member is requesting the loan to buy products for her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mirando hacia un Futuro Mejor” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de minimarket, desde hace 12 meses. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa, de lunes a domingo y su horario de trabajo es de 8ºº horas hasta la 21ººhoras, vende de todo lo que su clientela necesite como mercadería y ropa.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará volantines, ropa, azúcar, te, sal, detergente, tallarines, bebidas, verduras, carne, pollo y hamburguesas.
Una de las metas de Cecilia es tener su negocio lleno de mercadería y poner más estantes donde pueda mostrar toda sus productos, lo mas surtido posible para tener  más clientela, para generar mayores ingresos así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Cecilia vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 15 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su negocio grande, surtido y poner otro tipo de maquinas para su mercadería en cecinas, y a nivel personal cuidar y mantener su negocio, ya que anteriormente vendía su mercadería en la calle y logro tener su local en su casa, además pasa más tiempo con su familia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación y confianza. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the “Mirando Hacia un Futuro Mejor” [Looking Towards a Better Future] communal bank in the city of Talca.
She has had a minimarket for 12 months. She says that she works from home Mondays throught Sundays and works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. She sells everything her customers need such as merchandise and clothes. She buys her merchandise in different supermarkets and distributors where she can find it at a low cost, so it works out financially. 

With the loan, she will buy kites, clothes, sugar, tea, salt, detergent, pasta, beverages, produce, meat, chicken and hamburgers. One of Celia's goals is haveing her business full of merchandise and putting in more shelves where she can show all of her products, as stocked as possible to have more customers, generate more income and have a better quality of life. 

Cecilia lives with her husband and her 15 year old son who is in school. Her dreams for work are to have a well stocked, big business and to have the equipment to be able to sell jerky. Her dreams for her personal life are to care for and maintain her business, since previously she sold merchandise as a street vendor and she was able to set up her locale in her house. Also, to have more time with her family.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it allows her to invest in her business. In regards to the communal bank she is a member of, she remarks that there is good communication and trust there. In addition, the trainings have helped her learn new sales and accounting strategies.

Talca belongs to the Maule region, located in the central zone of the country. It is the administrative, financial and cultural center of the region, and the most important city in the Central Valley of Chile. There is a curious expression for Talca in Chile: "Talca, Paris and London". Among the stories about it are that an English person once said 'Talca looks like London" because of the the aboundant fog that frequently covers the city suring winter, giving it the appearance of the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy kites, clothes, sugar, tea, salt, detergent, pasta, beverages, produce, meat, chicken and hamburgers.

loans.name: Alex Alcivar

texts.es:
ALEX TIENEN 41 AÑOS ES CASADO VIVE CON LA ESPOSA Y CON LOS HIJOS EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS.

ALEX TRABAJA COMO  CHOFER DE UN TAXI, EL DINERO LO VA A INVERTIR EN BIENES PARA SU HOGAR COMO LAVADORA, MICROONDAS CAMAS PARA LOS HIJOS Y ALIMENTO, EL SUEÑO DE ALES ES SEGUIR TRABAJANDO PARA DAR LA EDUCACION A LOS HIJOS Y QUE ELLOS SEAN PROFESIONALES Y CON EL TIEMPO PUEDAN DEFENDERSE SOLOS EN EL TRANSCURSO DE LA VIDA.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA A DESCANSAR Y ESTAR CON LA FAMILIA POR QUE EL QUIERE MUCHO A LA ESPOSA QUE SE LLAMA BEATRIZ.
texts.en:
Alex, 41, is married and lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas.  Alex works as a taxi driver.

He's going to invest the money in goods for his home such as a washing machine, a microwave oven, beds for the children, and food.

Alex's dream is to continue working to give his children an education so they can be professionals and, in time, get by in life on their own.  In his free time he likes to rest and be with his family because he loves his wife Beatriz a lot.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine, a microwave oven, beds for the children, and food

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, age 35, has been been involved in the sales of fashion "lappers" (traditional cloth) for the past eight years. She lives in the Ganta area with her husband and their three children. The youngest is six years old and the eldest is 17. All three live at home and attend school. Before she started her business, Patricia ran a local "cook shop" (a small restaurant business). 

Patricia has requested a loan in order to purchase more fashion lappers, with the goal of expanding her venture into a larger business. Her primary obstacle is the exchanging of USD to Liberian dollars. 

What Patricia likes about her business is that she makes new friends and meets people each and every day. She is proud to be bringing in a daily income to help sustain her family. 

In future, she hopes to open another shop near the one she now operates.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion "lappers" (traditional cloth) to offer for sale, with the goal of expanding her venture into a larger business

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine, age 40, has been involved in the sale of bagged rice for the past six years. He started this business by selling on a tabletop at the market with a little money that he received from his father. He lives in the Ganta area with his wife, who runs her own business, and their three children. The youngest is 6 years old and the eldest is 13. All three live at home and attend school. 

Augustine's primary obstacle is that his shop needs essential renovations. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more bagged rice to offer for sale and to renovate his shop. 

His goal is to build a house for his family and to secure the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase more bagged rice to offer for sale and to renovate his shop

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew, age 43, sells shoes and sneakers to earn a living. He runs his shop in the area of Gbarnga. He started the business with the help of a loan from his friend, and he learned this way of selling from his mother. He and his wife have four children between the ages of six and 19, all of whom live at home and attend school.

Matthew's primary obstacle is lack of capital, which he needs to maintain his customer base and to attract new customers. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,00 Liberian Dollars in order to buy larger quantities and varieties of shoes and sneakers to offer for sale. He is confident that this will increase customer traffic to his business. 

Matthew enjoys his work and likes being busy with his business. His dream is to expand his business further, which will allow him to build a house for his family and to secure the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities and varieties of shoes and sneakers to offer for sale

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia, age 29, runs a small restaurant business where she cooks food and sells beverages. She has been engaged in this business for the past four years. She is a high school graduate and lives in Gbarnga with her husband, who runs his own business, and their three children. The youngest is five years old and the eldest is 12. All three live at home and attend school.

Cecelia reports that one of her primary obstacles is the high market cost of her customers' favorite beverages. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase these beverages as well as to buy rice and meat to prepare and serve to her customers.

Her goals for the near future are to expand her business and to secure the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to offer for sale, as well as rice and meat to prepare and serve to her customers

loans.name: Kayatu

texts.en:
Kayatu, age 45, repairs and re-sells cooking pots to earn a living. She has been engaged in this work for the past 13 years. She lives in Buchanan with her husband and their five children, who are between the ages of 10 to 25 years old.

Kayatu sold washing soap before she started her business. She enjoys her present work because it produces higher profits, which allows her to better attend to the needs of her family.  

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more pot-mending materials for the business. 

Her plan for the future is to ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for repairing and re-selling cooking pots

loans.name: Mandiaye

texts.fr: Mr Mandiaye âgé de 34 ans habite à quelques mètres de l’agence, marié et père de famille il s’active dans le commerce depuis quelques années.IL  gère l’activité de son frère en amenant un camion frigorifique au Mali avec un chauffeur pour acheter des poissons, son frère lui paie 75 000 f par mois. A chaque voyage il achète pour son propre compte des poissons et parfois des sacs d’oignons qu’il vient revendre au Sénégal et pour chaque voyage il gagne en moyenne 50 000 f ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins familiaux. Mr Mandiaye sollicite un prêt de 200 000 f pour l’achat de poissons qu’il compte revendre au Sénégal. Mr Mandiaye veut un jour avoir son propre véhicule et aller au Mali pour son propre compte.
texts.en:
Mandiaye is 34 years old and lives within a few yards of the agency. He is married and the father of a family, and has been engaged in business for the last few years. He manages his brother's business by bringing a refrigerated truck to Mali with a chauffeur to purchase fish; his brother pays him 75,000 francs CFA per month. 

On each trip Mandiaye also purchases fish for his own business account, and sometimes bags of onions which he comes back to Senegal to resell. Each trip earns him an average of 50,000 francs CFA which allows him to provide for his family's needs.

Mandiaye is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA for purchasing fish which he plans to resell in Senegal. He hopes one day to have his own vehicle and to go to Mali on his own business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 27 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and her husband is a social worker.  They have three children between the ages of 4 and 12 and all of them are attending school and live at home.  For the past 10 years Hannah has been selling used hand bags and clothes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more use hand bags and clothes for her business.  She plans to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used hand bags and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Decontee

texts.en: Decontee is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and has three children ages 2 to 11.  Two are in school and all of them live at home.  For the past three years she has been selling palm oil by the gallon in the local market.  She makes a lot of profit because she sells quality palm oil and has a lot of customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business.  Decontee hopes to build a house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia.  She is married and completed her education up to grade twelve.  She has seven children between the ages of 6 and 18 that live with her at home and attend school.  For the past five years she has been selling rice by the cup in the local market.  She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers and the profit she generates helps her to buy food for her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag.  Comfort plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Mr Lamine âgé de 32 ans habite à deux pas de l’Agence, célibataire il s’est très tôt lancé dans la couture depuis tout jeune, il a son propre atelier qu’il a loué à 20 000 f par mois.IL sollicite un prêt de 200 000 f pour l’achat de tissus qu’il va confectionner pour ensuite les revendre. Grace à ce prêt il pourra générer plus de revenus et de ce fait il pourra épargner et satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses parents.IL envisage un jour d’être  le propriétaire d’un grand atelier de couture où il sera parmi les meilleurs dans ce domaine.
texts.en: Lamine is 32 years old and lives very close to the branch. He is a single man who began sewing at a very early age and he has his own workshop which he rents for 20,000 francs a month. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy fabrics that he will make up to sell afterwards. Thanks to this loan he will be able to generate more income and thus be able to save money and satisfy his own needs as well as those of his parents. One day he enviseages becoming the owner of a large sewing workshop, where he will be one of the best in his field.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sew them up for display and resell them.

loans.name: Gpf Darou Mougnaguene Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Gpf darou mougnaguene" se compose de dix neuf femmes.Elles exploitent un champs collectif de mil et d'arachide dont la vente de la production leur rapporte des revenus assez consistants.Elles utilisent ces revenus pour prendre en charge leur propre bénéfices ainsi que ceux de leur famille.Le chef du groupement( à l'extrême gauche, en boubou noir) est mère de quatre enfants.Elle exerce un petit commerce de denrées alimentaire qui lui permet de renforcer ses revenus tirés du champs collectif des femmes.Afin d'augmenter leur production, les membres du GPF sollicitent un pret de 990000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais. Elles ambitionnent de se lancer dans la transformation des produits agricoles.
texts.en: The "GPF Darou Mougnaguene" group is made up of 19 women. They cultivate a collective field of millet and groundnut, and the sale of their crop brings them a fairly consistent income. They use this income to provide for their own needs as well as those of their families. The leader of the group (on the extreme left of the photo in a black boubou) is mother to four children. She has a small grocery business which enables her to boost her income from the collective field. In order to increase their crop, the members of the GPF group are requesting a loan of 990,000 francs to buy seeds and fertilizers. Their ambition is to launch themselves into processing their agricultural produce.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kullah

texts.en:
Kullah, age 24, lives in Buchanan. She is married with two children, ages 6 and 8 months old. The older child is in school. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the initial capital from her husband, Kullah was able to start a business. She has been selling men's jeans, body cream and ladies' jeans for the past nine years. What she likes about her business is the interaction with her customers and the sales that she generates from her business. 

Kullah has requested this loan to purchase more men's jeans, body cream and ladies' jeans for her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more men's jeans, body cream and ladies' jeans for her business.

loans.name: Theresa  F.

texts.en:
Theresa, age 34, has been working hard to manage her mini provisions shop for the past seven years. She is married with four children that stay with her in Buchanan. She started by selling cool water and was taught to sell by her husband. She sells bread, bath soap, hair gel, toothpaste, mayonnaise and other items. With the profit, she buys more goods to improve her business and attend to the needs of her family. 

Theresa is requesting this loan to purchase more hair gel, bread and mayonnaise to extend her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more hair gel, bread and mayonnaise to extend her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, age 29, is the mother of two children. She lives in Buchanan with her husband, who is a businessman. One of her children stays with her at home, and the other one stays with her aunt. 

Ruth has been selling rice, cooking oil, peppers, onions and other items in her community for the past 15 years. Because of the good interaction with her customers, she makes a lot of profit. With the profit, she buys more goods to improve her sales and help her husband with the expenses of the home.

Ruth is requesting this loan to purchase more cooking oil, peppers, rice and onions for the business in order to meet the demands of her customers. Her future plan is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, peppers, rice and onions for her business.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 32 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between the age of 2 months and 17. Two of them are attending school. 

For the past four years Satta has been selling dried goods (rice, oil, pepper, etc.) in her community market. She has a lot of customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (rice, oil, pepper, etc.) for her business. She plans to send her children to quality schools and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (rice, oil, pepper, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mapendo, vice présidente du groupe de crédit Dunda mu Yesu, Femme dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans. Elle est vendeuse de haricots. Elle fait également la coupe couture. Son mari est Enseignant dans une école primaire. Il ya 2 ans qu’elle fait le petit commerce. Plus tard, elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 7eme crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs de haricots. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The customer, Mapendo, who is vice-president of the Dunda mu Yesu loan group, is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 30 years old. She sells beans and also does dressmaking. Her husband is a teacher in a primary school. She has been trading for two years. More recently she was informed about the micro-loans granted by IMF Hékima. She was consequently granted a first loan of $50 to boost her business. The profits from her business are used for savings, as well as for her children's food and schooling. Meanwhile, she has just been granted her seventh loan. During this period, this customer has seen her business prosper. She has thus decided to increase her loan for this new cycle and will use it to buy two sacks of beans. In the future she would like to see her children grow up and buy a piece of land. The customer is grateful to Hekima for its actions to make poor women with low income more autonomous.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of beans.

loans.name: Lucretie

texts.en:
Lucretie lives in West Point. She is 40 years old and stopped her education in second grade. She is married and has five children between 9 and 20. They are in school and live at home.

She started her business selling cold water with an amount that she received from her sister. For the past 19 years, she has been buying and reselling palm oil. Currently she is selling chicken eggs. The problem she is facing is less commodity.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken eggs for her business. She plans to build a shop, build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken eggs for her business.

loans.name: Gpf Dieuf Dieul Keur Alassane Khodia Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes membres du groupement "Gpf dieuf dieul keur alassane khodia" s'activent toutes dans l'agriculture.Elles exploitent un champs collectif d'arachide mais chacune d'elle dispose aussi de son propre champs de mil et d'oseille.La vente de leur production d'arachide leur permet d'obtenir des revenus qui servent à satisfaire leurs propres besoins ainsi que certains besoins de leurs enfants.Le chef du groupe (au milieu, les deux doigts pointés), est la plus jeune.Elle est célibataire et vend parallèlement des vêtements et des tissus.Le groupe sollicite un pret de 600000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
texts.en: The five women members of the "Gpf Dieuf Keur Alassane Khodia" group are all farmers. They farm a collective field of groundnut, but each of them also has their own field of millet and sorrel. The sale of their groundnut crop enables them to earn sufficient income to satisfy their own needs as well as some of their children's needs. The head of the group (in the middle of the photo holding two fingers up) is the youngest. She is single and also sells clothes and fabrics. The group is requesting a loan of 600,000 francs to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is 46 and lives in West Point with five children between 8 and 23 years old.

For the past 23 years now, she has been operating a restaurant in her community. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business and learned it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a good profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, charcoal and meat for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, charcoal and meat for her business.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "BOK JOM" qui compte cinq membres , toutes des femmes mariées est un groupe de solidarité qui s'active dans l'agriculture.Ces femmes cultivent deux champs collectifs de mil et d'arachide.Elles produisent chaque hivernage une quantité assez importante dont la vente leur rapporte des revenus substantiels.Elles parviennent ainsi à prendre en charge leurs besoins d'habillement, de santé ainsi que certains besoins de leurs enfants.Le chef du groupement (au milieu, en foulard blanc) est mère de tris enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école.Elle vend en saison sèche des cacahuètes et des haricots pour améliorer ses revenus journaliers.Les femmes sollicitent un pret de 850000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais afin de renforcer leur production.
texts.en:
The Bok Jom group, which has five female members who are all married, is a solidarity group involved in agriculture. These women grow millet and peanuts on two shared fields, and during each rainy season they produce a significant amount, the sale of which provides them with substantial income. In this way they can provide for themselves in terms of clothing and healthcare, as well as covering some of their children’s needs.

The head of the group (pictured in the middle in a white headscarf) is a mother of three children, two of whom are at school. During the dry season she sells peanuts and beans to improve her daily income. The group members have requested a loan of 850,000 francs to buy seeds and fertilizers, which they will use to increase their harvest.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tewa H.

texts.en:
Tewa lives in Buchanan along with her four children who are between the ages of 15 and 25. Two of her children are in school. She is a widow.

For the past five years, Tewa has been selling slippers in the market. She started this business with a little money that she received from her husband before he died. Since the death of her husband, her business has helped her support her children and herself. She is requesting a loan to buy more slippers for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 2 to 18. Three of them are in school and all live at home.

For the past four years, Annie has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She enjoys the way her customers respond to her business. She learned this way of selling from her mother.  

Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. She plans to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 30 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has two children age 7 and 15. Both of them attend school and live at home.

For ten years Rebecca has sold charcoal in the market. Sometimes she has many customers and makes good money. She started this business by selling palm oil, but currently she sells charcoal.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to increase her business. She wants to improve and continue growing her business. She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to increase her business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mirando hacia un Futuro Mejor” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de puestos varios (kiosko) y amasandería (sopaipillas, tortillas, empanadas de queso, mariscos y pino), desde hace 10 años. Laura se desempeña en sus labores de lunes a lunes desde las 06ºº de la mañana hasta las 24ºº horas de la noche, trabaja en su casa y algunas veces en la feria ya que tiene gente trabajando en sus puestos.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes supermercados, distribuidoras y bodegas donde encuentra la harina a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará masas, harina, aceites, carne, queso, aceitunas.
Una de las metas de Laura en su negocio, son seguir adelante con el negocio, darle trabajo a gente que necesite, gracias al inicio de su negocio pudo comprar una camioneta donde salía a repartir o comprar sus empanadas, compró un terreno donde pudo instalar su local que le ha traído mucha satisfacción en su vida familiar y laboral.
Laura vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 20 años de edad quien se encuentra trabajando. Sus sueños a nivel personal es poder viajar, y a nivel familiar tener una buena vida y salud para la gente que está a su alrededor, y seguir dando trabajo a personas que lo necesiten, y tener la posibilidad de cambiar la camioneta para que la trabaje su hijo en la repartición de empanadas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda y apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Ademas comenta que se siente muy bien con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Laura is part of Mirando hacia un Futuro Mejor Communal Bank in the city of Talca.  For 10 years she has worked in the area of sales stalls (kiosks) and bakeries (sopaipillas; tortillas; and cheese, shellfish, and ground beef and onion empanadas).
