His wife helps him to run the business.  Niyoz is requesting a loan in the amount of $3000 to purchase household goods in order to expand the selection.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase household goods in order to expand the selection

loans.name: Hillary Wani

texts.en:
Hillary is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 12, all attending school. For the past 3 years, Hillary has operated a business selling mobile phones. He has no employees and no other source of income.

Hillary heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase phones and other items. In 5 years, Hillary would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenge is high prices in the market. Hillary says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru:
Мирзоали несколько лет кредитуется в нашей организации. Он является хорошим человеком, который чувствует свою ответственность. Предыдущий кредит Мирзоали использовал для закупа коровы и телят. Он увеличил количество крупнорогатого и мелко - рогато скота. Сейчас он продолжает свою деятельность. 
Мирзоали просит кредит для закупа бычков, телят и коз.
texts.en: Mirzoali has been obtaining financing from our organization for several years.  He is a good person, who understands his responsibilities.  Mirzoali used his previous loan to purchase cows and calves.  He increased the quantities of cattle and small livestock.  Currently, he continues his business.  Mirzoali is requesting this loan to buy bulls, calves and goats.

loans.use: to buy bulls, calves and goats

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Mom is a 43-year-old married mother of five children, four (one daughter and three sons) of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The family’s main source of income is rice farming on five hectares of farmland, which she has been involved in for 24 years. She currently earns about KHR20,000 per day. Drought is the main challenge she faces.

Mom has already received and repaid one VisionFund loan which helped her relieve her family's burden, while the other member of the group has received and repaid two loans. Now requesting a new group loan, Mom, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and to pay for gasoline.

She hopes this loan will enable her to make her farming business more productive and profitable so she can better support her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sarah Mama

texts.en: Sarah Mama  sells second-hand ladies' and children's dresses; she has been selling second-hand dresses for 3 years now. Sarah is single. She uses her income to pay her utility and accomodation bills. Sarah needs this loan to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit Sarah plans to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is 22 years old. He is married and a father of one child who is one year old. He operates a barber shop and has been in the business for the past three years. He gets a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase methylated spirit, towels, soaps, razors and face towels, all for use in his business.

He hopes to assist his wife to expand her business and educate his child.

loans.use: to purchase methylated spirit, towels, soaps, razors and face towels.

loans.name: Ibroim

texts.ru:
Иброим житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 24 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Иброим живет с женой и матерью. У Иброима высшее образование. По профессии он экономист. На сегодняшний день Иброим занимается торговлей. Он открыл небольшой продуктовый магазин, где работает продавцом. 
Иброим просит кредит для покупки продуктов.
texts.en: Ibroim is a resident of the J. Rumy district.  He is 24 years old, married and has one child.  Ibroim lives with his wife and mother.  He has a higher education.  He is an economist.  Today, Ibroim is involved in sales.  He opened a small food market, where he works as a salesperson.  Ibroim is requesting this loan to purchase food products.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredient for the preparation of her "waakye" for sale

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Ms. Munawar is a widow and she has been in a lot of difficulty after the death of her husband. She started the work of selling milk 3 years ago to support her family. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Now she has good number of customers and has two buffaloes and one cow for this purpose. Her business is good enough to lead her civilized life.
 

Being a single parent of three sons and three daughters, she is striving for the betterment of her family. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She wants to improve her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. She needs a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy one more cow and feed for the buffaloes. She hopes to have an increase in her production capacity which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: To buy one more cow and feed for the buffaloes.

loans.name: Kyzylgul

texts.ru:
Кызылгул 65 лет, вдова, воспитала 2 детей. Кызылгул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  20 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кызылгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом, 1,4 га земли, где выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы,  ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). Также, Кызылгул выращивает в саду ягоды и фрукты, что приносит небольшой урожай в основном для нужд ее семьи.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кызылгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров для увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Кызылгул планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, а дома хотела бы провести косметический ремонт.
texts.en: Kyzylgul is 65 years old, a widow and raised two children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 20 years, having started this business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Kyzylgul's hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow with offspring and 1.4 hectares of land, where she grows beans, potatoes and perennial herbs.  The monthly profit from the business amounts to about 5,000 som (KGS).  Also, Kyzylgul grows berries and fruits in her garden, which brings in a small harvest primarily for her family's needs.  In order to further develop her business, Kyzylgul requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk volumes.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued business development and wants to make cosmetic repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk volumes

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua  cooks  'banku' (fermented maize balls) and 'Ga-kenkey' for sale. She serves it  with vegetables and fish sauce at  Esuakyire   near Abura. She is married with two children.

 Efua has been in this business for 5 years now. She uses her income for the gerneral upkeep of their children.  

Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her 'banku' and 'kenkey' for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her 'kenkey'.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her 'banku' and 'kenkey' for sale

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 24 years old. She is married but has no children yet.  She has been engaged in running a sari-sari store for a period of 5 months.  She earns income from her business averaging Php 2,000 a month.  She took a loan from PMPC in the amount of Php 3,000 to purchase additional grocery stock for sale.  She hopes that maybe someday she can expand her business and even establish another line of business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to stock

loans.name: Ana Matilde

texts.es: Ana con su anterior credikiva  compró materias primas en mayor volumen y elaboró sus mejores diseños de confecciones, que vendió prontamente. Ella no compró la fileteadora porque debió invertir su dinero en varios contratos que le salieron consecutivamente y rotaba rapidamente su inversión. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, que invertirá en la compra de una máquina fileteadora y una máquina plana, con las que se dispone a aumentar la calidad de sus productos y mejorar los tiempos productivos y esto ocurrirá, gracias a Kiva por eso envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores: “Gracias a Dios por personas como ustedes, dispuestas a ayudar a los demás, recordando el amor al prójimo. Dios los bendiga de gran manera y sigan apoyando tan especial labor. “
texts.en:
With her previous loan from Kiva, Ana bought raw material in larger quantities and made her best designs in clothing, which sold promptly.

She did not purchase the overlock machine before because she needed to invest her money in various contracts that came consecutively to be able to rotate her stock rapidly. She is currently requesting a new Kiva loan to buy a sewing machine and overlock machine. With these new machines, she expects to increase the quality of her products and improve the production time and this is thanks to Kiva, this is why she sends the following message to her Kiva funders: "Thank God for people like you that are ready to help others, by remembering neighbor´s love. God bless you greatly and continue to support so special work. "

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and overlock machine.

loans.name: Isacio

texts.es:
El señor Isacio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado tiene 9 hijos y  vive en su propia casa; debe trabajar arduamente para mantener a sus hijos, lo hace con sacrificio y esfuerzo.
El señor Isacio tiene su propio negocio es propietario de una despensa  donde vende minutas y además fabrica calzados para luego venderlos, a lo largo del tiempo pudo tratar con una clientela variada gracias a la calidad de su trabajo.
Con el crédito el señor desea comprar lo necesario para que su negocio funcione, por ello necesita palanganas, suelas para calzados, y cuerina.
texts.en:
Isaico is 55 years old. He is married and has 9 children. He lives in his own home and must work hard to support his children, which he does with effort and sacrifice.

Isaico has his own business as the proprietor of a shop where he sells foodstuffs. In addition, he also makes and sells shoes. Over time, he has been able to cater to a diverse clientele, thanks to the quality of his work.

With this loan, Isaico wants to buy what he needs to run his business, so he needs washbasins, soles for shoes and imitation leather.

loans.use: To buy rice, meats, milk, soles for shoes and imitation leather, etc

loans.name: Thorng's Group

texts.en:
Thorng is a married mother of four children: one daughter and three sons, all of whom are dependents and still in school. Thorng is 33 years old and lives in a rural area in the Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in rice farming for several years and supplements her income by working for others as well. Her current business earns her about KHR 20,000 per day. She manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day after covering daily expenses.

Thorng is the leader of her loan group, which includes one other member. This is the first loan for both of them with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. Thorng is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her living standards and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Atilio Okur

texts.en:
Atilio  is a 35-year-old  businesswoman  who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3  and 13. All of them go to school.

Atilio  runs a general store and has been in business for six years. She has no  employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through  other clients. She is taking a loan of  1000 sdg to purchase maize flour, clothes,  and many other items.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years Atilio  would like to expand her  business and open  a big store. Her  major challenges include high  prices in the market.

Atalio  says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan  with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like flour, clothes, etc

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en:
Kurbon is 50 years old. He is married and has four children. He has been busy with animal husbandry more than four years. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of his customers are local butchers who are glad about his work. 

Kurbon is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona lives in Ashotavan, Syunik region, with her mother, Natalia, and sister, Arshaluys. Sona and her family are involved in agriculture. They run a farm, where they keep cows, a turkey, cultivate potatoes and barley and grow fruit trees. Current income for Sona and her family is barely enough to make ends meet. 

Sona would like to increase the number of cattle she raises. With the help of this loan she will purchase two oxen, two sheep, two pigs, as well as forage for them. These purchases will significally increase Soan's income from agriculture, which will allow her to continue investment in the development of her venture.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, two sheep, two pigs and forage

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok lives in a rural area located in Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 39 years old and single. To earn a living, Sok has been farming rice and planting chillies for five years. The business earns her approximately KHR 20,000 per day and she manages to save about KHR 5,000 each day after expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her business. 

Sok’s group consists of two members who are both females and live in the same village. Sok is taking her second loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and is acting as the group leader. Sok used her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation. She hopes to increase her income from this business to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en: Barikisu sells soap, cosmetics and powdered soap at Esuekyir near Abura.  She is married. Barikisu has been in this business for five years.  She supports her husband with the upkeep of the family. Barikisu will use her loan to purchase a variety of soaps and cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to aquire a shop for the sale of the soap and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of soaps and cosmetices to sell

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina cooks Ga-style kenkey to sell. She serves it with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at Esuakyire near Abura. She is married with five children. Sakina has been in this business for 10 years now.  She uses her income for the general upkeep of her children. Sakina will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her Ga-style kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish to prepaare Ga-style kenkey to sell

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is involved in agriculture. He breeds cows and hens and cultivates cucumber, tomato, and watermelon and also grows fruit trees. Vahn lives with his wife, mother, son and daughter.

Vahan is requesting a loan to start breeding pigs. He will use his loan to purchase two pigs and forage and he will also add new apple, apricot, and plum saplings to his orchard. Vahan will significantly increase his agriculture profit which is important for him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs, forage, and apple, apricot, and plum trees

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
Leang is a 35-year-old married mother of two daughters, both of whom are dependents and still in school. She lives in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Leang has been a rice farmer for several years and supplements her family’s income by planting beans. She is able to earn about KHR 25,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 8,000 each day after daily expenses. The main challenge to her business is low crop yields caused by insects. 

Leang’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. This is the first loan of all members in the group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group members are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. Leang, the group leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay for laborers. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income and also hopes to expand her current business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na, aged 63, lives in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of three children. She and her husband have been farming rice for twenty-eight years. They supplement the family’s income by growing beans and sometimes working for others. Their business earns them about KHR 20,000 per day and they manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day. 

This is the first loan for Na’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Leading the group of three, Na, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay for labor costs. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Ms Robina is a famous tailor who stitches clothes for more then half of the community she lives in. She started this line of work almost three years ago when her husband died. To date, she is a successful tailor with two stitching machines and her daughter as her assistant who helps her so she may fulfill orders in less time. However, life was not always like this for her. There were many occasions when her husband would come home intoxicated and beat her in front of her children, causing more damage to her self-respect than to her body. Incidents like these always made her want to work on her own and support her children who were petrified because of these constant beatings. It was after her husband’s death that she contacted Kashf and decided to take a loan.

Currently, she borrowed RS 30,000 to purchase another stitching machine, laces and threads. She told Kashf; “This is what I have done; nothing remarkable but I have fulfilled my responsibility towards my children who will now go to school and gain knowledge that I was never able to acquire.”

loans.use: To purchase another stitching machine, lace and threads.

loans.name: Ghulamfiza

texts.en:
Ms. Ghulamfiza is a passionate woman and doing a work of boutique and embroidery for the last four years. She has been working night and day making elegant dresses for woman in her community. Her collection is very famous in her town. She offers a variety of clothes in different colors to her customers and makes enough money to lead a decent life.

She is a loving mother of three daughters and two sons. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000/- to buy a stock of more cloth of different colors in various designs and lace, thread and machines. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of more cloth of different colors in various designs and lace, thread and machines.

loans.name: Krobo Group

texts.en:
Krobo group is made up of seven ladies who are from Teshie. This group was formed in 2009 and has been together till now. They sell yams, fish, cocoyams, turkey meat, maize, cooking utensils and underwear. They meet on every Monday to discuss business and repayment of the loan. They have been with ID-Ghana since 2010 and are loyal.

Elina is 37 years old and sells underwear. She is married to a 45-year-old security guard and two children who are schooling. This is her 5th loan cycle with ID-Ghana. She has improved her business quickly by graduating from one loan cycle to another. Her children's ages are 12 years and 15 years old.

She has been doing this job for 8 years and has a lot of experience.  She needs this loan to buy ladies' wear; there is a demand from customers. She was given 500 Ghana cedis in the 4th loan cycle and now needs 700 Ghana cedis to expand her business. Her monthly profit is 90 Ghana cedis which she uses in part to help husband with family expenses and part for reinvestment.

The women need a total amount of 2,600 Ghana cedis to able to meet customer demand

loans.use: to buy ladies' wear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
Seak is a 49-year-old widowed mother of two sons living in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She has struggled to earn a living through rice farming. To add to her income, she also grows beans and works for others. Seak has been in this business for twenty-four years. She can earn approximately KHR 17,000 per day.

Seak’s group consists of three members who are all female. She leads her group which is requesting their first loan from VisionFund. Seak plans to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay for labor costs. She hopes to earn more income from her business to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Hean is a 52-year-old married mother of ten children, three (one daughter and two sons) of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Hean is originally from a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. For almost thirty years, she and her husband have farmed rice and raised pigs to support the family. The current business earns their family about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. An inadequate water supply is still the main challenge for her business.

Hean has taken a first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she and her group members are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farm. She hopes to increase her income from her current business to improve her living standards and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El Comité Santa María tiene 10 integrantes, se encuentra en su 1° ciclo, se las ve entusiasmadas y con ganas de progresar pos si solas y como grupo.
La sra. Juana, es una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la venta en su despensa, y desea agrandar su negocio para poder brindar a su clientela mayor variedad de productos y a su familia una mejor vida.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, huevos, leches, frutas, verduras, cigarrillos, etc. y poderlos ofrecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Santa Maria committee has 10 members and they are in their first loan cycle.  They are very enthusiastic about progressing for themselves and for the group.

Juana is one of the members and she sells food from her stand.  She would like to enlarge her business so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of products and her family a better life.

She is requesting a loan to buy meat, eggs, milk, fruit, vegetables, cigarettes, etc so that she can offer them in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, milk, eggs, meat, etc

loans.name: Thomas Muroge

texts.en:
Thomas is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. All of them go to school.

Thomas runs a business selling fruit and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase maize flour, clothes and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Thomas would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Thomas says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva .

loans.use: for buying more items like bananas, etc

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 54 years old and a business man; he is married to Grace, a peasant farmer. They are blessed with seven children. He has been operating livestock trading as a primary business and mixed crop farming as a secondary business for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 14,500 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. David will use the loan to buy goats for sale. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses hence improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to buy goats for sale

loans.name: Mbovu

texts.en:
Mbovu is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kaloleni in the coastal region of Kenya. He is married and has two children who are still too young for school. For the past three years, Mbovu has been working hard to manage his fish selling business which has been growing each day. In addition,he sells fried potatoes from the same place.

To help expand his business, Mbovu has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more fish, cooking oil, and a sack of potatoes, and will help Mbovu to generate greater profits and increase his daily income. Mbovu hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a big retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more fish, cooking oil, and sack of potatoes

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en:
Hajiran is an active lady who has been successfully running a CD and DVD shop for the past five years. She has great collection of music and movies and her husband assists her in the business. Hajiran has the only CD shop in her town and they have massive customer base of all ages. She and her husband have three daughters and one son, all of whom go to school.

Hajiran is requesting a 45,000 PKR loan to buy stocks of CDs and DVDs. She will expand her movie and music collection to improve her selection. Hajiran hopes to earn more income to cover her family's everyday expenses and lead to a respectable life. Her loan will enable her to sustain her business and better support her family.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs of different movies and music to improve her selection

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives in Sisian town with her husband. The couple is involved in agriculture and keeps beehives and cultivate wheat and potatoes. 

Ani is requesting a loan to purchase 20 bee colonies to increase her agriculture income. She will also use her loan to purchase seeds to cultivate and fuel for her tractor. Developing their business is vital for this young couple to improve their income and create better living conditions for their children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bees, seeds, and tractor fuel

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna continues running her dry fish selling business. She also stocks vegetables in the same stall. It is located in a strategic place, which, with great effort, she has stocked with a variety of vegetables.

She is a person who has always liked working in order to help her husband with the household expenses. It is a business activity that she has always liked doing. 

The loan she is requesting from Yehu is to stock her stall with more vegetables and dry fish. Her objective for doing this is to get greater income that will allow her family to improve their standard of living. Kuvuna tells us that the previous loan was of great help since it enabled her to increase her income. Thanks for the support given to her.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and dry fish to stock her stall with.

loans.name: Baybaba

texts.en: Baybaba is 51 years old and married. He has three daughters and tries to do his best for them. He works around 10 hours a day and enjoys his work. He sells food items in the local market. He has been engaged in his business for five years. Baybaba requested a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN from the AqroInvest to increase his product turnover by purchasing sugar, tea, oil, butter and others products. Baybaba is very grateful for Kiva loans.

loans.use: to increase his product turnover by purchasing sugar, tea, oil, butter and other products

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Alex has been working hard to manage his grocery, which sells sugar, soap and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, posho and other local foods to sell, and will help Alex to generate greater profits and will improve his family's livelihood. Alex hopes that in the future he will be able to set up another business. 

Alex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more rice, posho and other local foods to sell

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir lives in the town of Agcabadi. Azerbaijan. He is 31 years old. He is married and his wife is a housewife. For the past four years, Samir has been operating a green-grocery business. He sells fruits and vegetables such as lemons, apples, pears, grapes, bananas to the people in his community and to passers-by. This is his second loan from AqroInvest and he is very grateful for this second opportunity. Samir requested this loan of 1000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables. His biggest dream is to open a grocery store. Samir gives his thanks in advance for support given.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 51 years old and a single mother of one.  She runs a retail shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business for over 20 years. She has employed one person in her business.  She also does farming to earn extra income.  Monica hopes to expand her business in the future.
She has requested for 50,000 KES to buy rice, tea leaves, cooking fat and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy rice, tea leaves, cooking fat and charcoal

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es:
Tereza, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica  a la venta de ropa y accesorios para ambos sexos, trabajando por más de diez horas al día ya que debe ayudar con los gastos de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una Lap Top ya que desea estudiar computación y esto le será de mucha ayuda para sus prácticas.
El sueño de Tereza, es ser profesional y mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Tereza is single and has no children. She lives in her parents' home, occupying just one room. The house is located in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

Currently she is earning income, as she sells clothing and accessories for both sexes; working more than 10 hours a day, as she must help with her family's expenses for basic services.

She needs the loan for the purchase of a laptop, as she wishes to study computing, and this will help her a great deal with her practice assignments. 

Tereza's dream is to be a professional and improve her income, so that she can become independent and improve her quality of life. 

It is the first time that she has applied for a loan from IMPRO and Kiva

loans.use: To buy a laptop in order to begin studying for a diploma in computing.

loans.name: Maly's Group

texts.en:
Maly is from a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is 23 years old and married with one son who is under school-aged. The main source of the family’s income is rice farming. Her husband supplements their income by raising pigs. They can earn about KHR 50,000 per day to support the family’s needs. Flooding is the main challenge for their field business. 

Maly has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully paid back her loans. Her group member is just in her first cycle with VisionFund. The past loans have helped Maly to better to support her family. Now leading her group of two, Maly will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 7 years, Stella has been working hard to manage her salon, where she retouches, treats and plaits hair. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more braids, weaves and threading equipment, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and it will improve her family's standard of living. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger salon. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more braids, weaves and threading equipment

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her stationery shop, which sells books and files and makes photocopies. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy books, reams of paper, school chalk and manila folders, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and will help the borrower buy more stock and the increased sales will help her family pay bills. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to set up another stationery shop. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy books, reams of paper, school chalk and manila folders

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 47 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife, his son and his mother. His mother is a pensioner. His wife does housework and tries to do the best for the family. Zakaria runs an agricultural business. In, particular, he has a plot of land where maize is grown. He sells maize locally. In addition, Zakaria works as a welder for a private company and gets a monthly salary. He is a very hardworking, responsible person with a lot of experience in his work.

Zakaria requested a loan to set a welding shop. He has a space near his house and he will purchase building materials to repair an existing old building and operate iron work business on his own. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Zakaria will improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to set up a welding shop

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Ms Naila had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Two years ago she began stitching work in her house.  She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is married and provides for 2 children.  She is currently in her 2nd loan cycle and has borrowed Rs 20,000 from Kashf. She intents to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: To buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips etc.

loans.name: Panchito Lopez Group

texts.es:
El comite Panchito Lopez esta conformado por 12 integrantes que en su mayoría se dedican a ser amas de casas encargandose de las tareas domésticas y de sus hijos con suma responsabilidad, cariño y dedicación.
Una de las señoras, María es ama de casa y todos los días se encarga de mantener su hogar ordenado cuidando que nada falta ni para ella ni para los demás miembros de la familia. De igual manera aporta a la canasta familiar con su miniemprendimiento, ya que en sus ratos libres se dedica a hacer collares, aros, pulseras para venderlos, etc.
La señora solicita el crédito para continuar con su micro emprendimiento, y poder comprar insumos como canutillos, hilo de pescar, tijeras y así poder seguir elaborando materiales para la venta.
texts.en:
The group Panchito Lopez is made up of 12 members, most of whom are dedicated to being housewives, taking care of household chores and their children with great responsibility, love and dedication.

One of the women, Maria, is a homemaker and every day, she makes sure her home is in order, taking care that neither she nor the members of her family lack for anything. In a similar manner, she contributes to the family expenses with her small business; in her spare time, she makes necklaces, earrings, bracelets, etc. to sell.

Maria is requesting this loan to continue with her small business and be able to buy supplies such as beads, fishing line and scissors, and in this way be able to continue crafting materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy supplies: beads, fishing line, scissors, etc.

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
El comité San Pablo esta conformado por 14 integrantes con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas invierten el crédito obtenido en su propio negocio para así poder aumentar las ventas y las ganancias.
La señora Carmen tiene un puesto de venta donde se pueden encontrar todo tipo de productos ya sea de limpieza, higiene, lácteos, panificados, verduras, etc. Gracias a su esfuerzo diario, la señora ya cuenta con una clientela regular a quienes les ofrece siempre el mejor precio y calidad.
Con el crédito obtenido ella podrá comprar productos para su despensa y podrá ofrecerlos en mayor variedad y cantidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: The “San Pablo” committee has 14 members with various activities.  Each member invests the loan she got in her business to increase sales and profits.  Carmen has a stand where she sells all sorts of products: cleaning supplies, personal hygiene products, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, etc.  Thanks to her daily effort she already has a well-established regular clientele that she offers the best prices and quality to.  With this loan she will able to y products for her store and have a wider variety and more quantity available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies, personal hygiene products and food.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Librada esta conformada por 13 integrantes que cuentan con actividades comerciales variadas todas ellas dedicadas a la venta; y con esfuerzo y dedicación logran satisfacer dentro de sus actividades a su clientela y satisfacer a la vez a su canasta familiar.
La señora María es vendedora de chipa, gracias a su sacrificio diario de acudir al puesto laboral la señora ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y cubrir algunos gastos de manutención.
Ella desea obtener el préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de ingredientes como almidón, queso, harina de maíz, leche, grasa de cerdo,así realizar más chipas para vender.
texts.en: The “Santa Librada” committee has 13 members with various commercial activities.  All of them are in sales.  With effort and dedication they are able to provide customer satisfaction in their activities while at the same time meeting their basic needs.  María sells chipa [traditional cheese cornbread].  Thanks to her daily sacrifice of going to her workplace daily she’s been able to raise her family and cover some of the costs of daily support.  She wants to get the loan to be able to buy larger amounts of ingredients like flour, cheese, corn flour, milk, lard to make more chipas to sell.

loans.use: to buy flour, cheese, corn flour, milk, etc.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn, 58 years old, lives in a rural area located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has one three children, one daughter of whom works at a garment factory. Sorn has made a living through farming rice for 30 years. The current business earns her about 7,000 KHR per day. 

Sorn’s group consists of nine members who are all females living in the same village. Sorn has taken 13 loans from VisionFund while the other members have taken from one to thirteen loans. Sorn successfully repaid the past loans, which have helped to improve her family living conditions through income generated from the business. Now Sorn and her group members are applying for a loan of 160,000 KHR each to buy materials for constructing proper potties for their families. Such materials consist of a toilet bowl, cement, bricks etc. Sorn hopes this loan will enable her family have a proper and hygienic latrine to use.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a proper latrine

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  To earn a living, she runs a retail shop. She has three years of experience in the business and has employed one person.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business because she has been trained on business management skills.
Zipporah hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested for 30, 000 KES to add stock of sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and soap.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and soap

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mubende, Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Jackson has been working hard to manage his grocery store, where he sells beans, maize and g-nuts. 

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce like rice and posho, and will help Jackson to generate greater profits and help pay school fees. Jackson hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another store. 

Jackson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce like rice and posho

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, 53, is a widow who has six independent children.  She is a hardworking, responsible person, who, thanks to her own effort and the loan microfinance partner, Yehu, has made improvements to her home. She wants to benefit from Kiva's help in order to make further improvements.  Despite her advanced age, Elizabeth has been able to successfully operate her tailoring business, making dresses and blouses. She is determined to succeed despite being a widow. She tells us that her husband used to encourage her and advise her on how she could progress in life. Thanks to that, the advice was not blown by air but has remained ringing in her mind. Her goal is to expand her business. Due to lack of enough capital, she is requesting a loan from Kiva through Yehu so as to purchase clothing materials.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Getrude has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more kids and adult clothes, and will help Getrude to generate greater profits and complete her unfinished house. Getrude hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her residential house. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Getrude who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more kids' and adult clothes.

loans.name: Duo Palomas Mensajeras Group

texts.es: Dúo Palomas Mensajeras: este dúo está integrado por la señora Marta Albertina ella es originaria de San Juna Comalapa, tiene 5 hijos menores de edad ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace varios años, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de maíz, y leña para la elaboración de tortillas, ya que necesita producir más para tener mejore ganancias y así poder darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carrier Pigeons Duo.

Marta Albertina is one of the members of this duo.  She’s from San Juan Comalapa.  She has five minor children and has worked making tortillas to sell for several years.  She’s requesting the loan to buy corn and firewood to make the tortillas since she needs to produce more in order to earn higher profits and give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Elvira Francisca

texts.es:
Elvira Francisca vive en el municipio de El Sauce, ubicado al occidente del departamento de León, es una señora de 41 años, sauceña de corazón, casada, con 4 hijos de los cuales dos tiene a su cargo en edad escolar.
Desciende de una familia humilde y trabajadora que toda su vida se han dedicado al comercio de carne de res. Hoy en la actualidad cuenta con su propio negocio el cual es familiar porque trabaja con sus hijos y su esposo. Es una carnicería muy popular conocida por todos los pobladores de dicho municipio donde ofrecen carne de res y de cerdo, la que se caracteriza por ser de buena calidad.

Cabe señalar que este negocio ha tenido éxito por la unidad de esta familia, ya que sus hijos van aprendiendo desde muy temprana edad el amor al trabajo y la actividad que realizan sus padres. Desde muy temprano ellos salen a las distintas comarcas en busca del ganado o cerdos que serán destazados para su respectiva comercialización mientras tanto sus padres se dedican a realizar otras gestiones.
 
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuatro vacas para su destace, ya que tienen mucha demanda de sus clientes y por la temporada de invierno el ganado tiene un precio caro.

Se siente muy agradecida y satisfecha por el apoyo que le ha brindado KIVA y Ceprodel, ya que con estos créditos ha logrado mantener su negocio el que le ha permitido construir su propia vivienda y adquirir bienes que son de gran importancia para su hogar.
texts.en:
Elvira Francisca lives in the town of El Sauce located in the west of León Department.  She’s a 41-year-old woman who is a Sauceña through and through.  She’s married and has four children two of which are still school age and in her care.

She comes from a humble, hardworking family that has worked as beef merchants their entire life.  Today, she has her own business which is a family business too because she works with her children and her husband.  It’s a very popular, well-known butcher shop among the residents of said town; they sell beef and pork that’s noted for being good quality.

It’s worth noting that the business has been successful because of this family’s togetherness since the children start learning while still very young to love work and the activity their parents do.  Starting very early they go out to the various districts looking for cattle or pigs that will be butchered to be sold while their parents do other tasks.

She is asking for a loan to buy four cows to butcher since customer demand is high and during the winter cattle is expensive.  She feels very grateful and satisfied with the support she’s gotten from Kiva and Ceprodel because she’s been able to stay in business thanks to these loans and this has allowed her to build her own house and acquire assets that are very important for her home.

loans.use: to buy four cows.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is a newly recognized member under the individual program of PMPC.  She is a single mom of at with three kids. She has operated a sari-sari store business for five years earning an income of at least PHP 3,000 per month. She took a loan from PMPC to purchase additional stock to sell to increase her income to feed her children and provide a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy autumn season clothes to sell ahead of the beginning of the school year

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Cándida es originaria del municipio de Catarina del departamento de Masaya, desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de productos de carne y pollo que son del uso diario comestible de las familias, ella es casada, su núcleo formado por sus tres hijos y su esposo.
 Ella vende su producto todos los días pero en especial el día bueno son los domingos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación por lo que siempre ella esta al pendiente de sus clientes de darle un buen servicio.
 Ellos ya la conocen en el sector y también tiene una ventaja que solo ella tiene ese tipo de negocio. Doña cándida necesita comprar pollo, y una vaca para destace porque también le sale mejor comprarla para poder sacar mas ganancia. Nos visita a nuestra oficina Ceprodel para adquirir un préstamo y poder aprovechar de invertirle más a su negocio. Considera que esta ayuda le permitirá salir adelante en el futuro de sus hijos, y le podrá tener una mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Cándida is from the town of Catarina in Masaya department. She has been selling meat and chicken products for six years. These are food products used by families daily. She is married, and her immediate family is made up of her husband and three children. 

She sells her product every day, but her Sundays are especially good. Her business is located in her home, so she is always attentive to customers and gives them good service. 

They already know her in the area, and she also has an advantage, in that she alone has this kind of business. Cándida needs to buy chicken and a cow to butcher because it is also better for her to buy it, so that she can earn more profit. 

She is visiting the Ceprodel office to obtain a loan and to be able to take advantage of the opportunity to invest more in in her business. 

She considers that this assistance  will allow her and her children to succeed in the future, and provide her family with greater comfort.

loans.use: To buy a cow for butchering, as well as chicken meat.

loans.name: Aichurok

texts.ru:
Айчурок 62 года, вдова, воспитала 2 детей. Айчурок в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 30 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айчурок в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 дойные  коровы с приплодом, 5 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 3,000 сом (KGS). Также Айчурок обрабатывает 1,8 га земли, где выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы, доход от этого вида бизнеса сезонный. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айчурок обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров в целях увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Айчурок планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения посевной земли.
texts.en:
Aichurok is a 62-year-old widow and mother of two. She acts as the main provider for her family. For 30 years, she has worked in crop farming and animal husbandry, a business she started with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work, today Aichurok's farm has two calving dairy cows and five heads of sheep and goats, and her animal husbandry brings in profits of about 3,000 som (KGS) a month. Aichurok also works 1.8 hectacres of land, where she grows beans, potatoes and perennial herbs and grasses. Income from this part of the business is seasonal.

Looking towards the long-term development of her business, Aichurok applied for a 55,000 som (KGS) loan at Bai Tushum & Partners. The loan is for the purchase of dairy cows with the goal of increasing milk production. With the income created by the loan, Aichurok plans to invest in the further development of her business by expanding her land cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Shakirah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells bread, soap and other household staples. 

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize flour, cooking oil, jelly, and rice, and will help Shakirah to generate greater profits and allow her to develop her family more. Shakirah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bigger retail shop. 

Shakirah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shakirah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, cooking oil, jelly and rice

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 32 year-old business lady and a single mother of two children. She has been running a green grocer business for the past four years with the monthly income of KES.15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mercy will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Osman Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Waterloo, located about 22 mile from Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to solicit a loan of 13,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Osman is the leader of this group of teachers. The 37 year-old is a native of Freetown. He is married to a trader and has 2 school-aged children. Osman has been a teacher for many years now. In addition to his teaching profession, Osman is also a businessman. He has been doing business for 5 years now. As teachers' salaries are normally small, his business helps him earn extra money to complement his monthly salary. Osman has requested for this loan in order to expand his business by buying local produce like rice, palm-oil, etc., in bulk to add to his current stock. He can also use part of the loan to take care of his home.

loans.use: to buy local produce like rice, palm-oil, etc., in bulk to add to his current stock. He can also use part of the loan to take care of his home.

loans.name: Sotheary's Group

texts.en:
Sotheary, 30 years old, has three dependent children: one daughter and two sons, all of whom are still in school. Her family lives in the rural village of Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. The main sources of the family’s income arefrom farming rice and planting beans. They supplement their income by raising cows and chickens, which she and her husband have been doing for several years. Drought that destroyed the crop yield is still the main challenge for her business. 

Sotheary’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. This is their first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now, Sotheary and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and KHR 800,000, respectively. As the group leader, Sotheary is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm

loans.name: José Jaime

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas, lo aprendió con unos amigos, pues su papá no se dedicaba a eso. Cuando se caso, vio la necesidad de trabajar para mantener su hogar, por esa razón desempaño la agricultura. Además, de esa actividad, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la albañilería, trabajo que aprendió con unos amigos. Debido a la necesidad don José manifiesta que ha tenido que aprender muchas cosas.  Entre ellas también esta el trabajar con bueyes arando las tierras para realizar los cultivos, él se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para dar de comer a su bueyes y tomarse una taza de café, luego sale a  su trabajo que esta a media hora de su casa, llega a las 12: 00 p.m. a dar de comer a los bueyes.

Los productos que necesita los compra en la ciudad, para llegar a ese lugar camina a pie unos quince minutos, luego aborda un autobús que recorre durante cuarenta y cinco minutos para llegar a la ciudad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un saco de maicillo, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y  pago de mano de obra.  Con la inversión, él dispondrá de los insumos necesarios para realizar sus cultivos y obtener una buena cosecha que le permita ganar dinero. Entre sus planes están: el ahorrar de los ingresos obtenidos; para construir una casa de ladrillo, pues actualmente vive en una casa de bahareque y el que sus hijos terminen de estudiar una carrera universitaria. Pues a él no se le presento esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
José, 38, lives with his life companion and their two children.  He’s been working in agriculture for the last 20 years; he learned from some friends because his father was not in that occupation.  When he got married he saw that he needed to work to support his home which is why he went into agriculture.  

In addition to this activity, he’s also worked in construction for the last 10 years, work he also learned with friends.  José states that need has led him to learn many things.  Among them is also tilling the land using oxen.  He rises at 4am to feed his oxen and drink a cup of coffee and then heads out to work which is half an hour away from home.  He returns at noon to feed the oxen.  He buys the products he needs in the city and to get there he walks for fifteen minutes to catch a bus that then takes 45 minutes to reach the city.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a sack of sorghum, fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide and to pay labor costs.  With this investment he will have the necessary supplies on hand to plant and to obtain a good harvest that will allow him to earn money.  

Among his plans are: to save some of the income earned to build a brick house because he currently lives in a wattle and daub dwelling and that his children complete university careers because he never had the opportunity to do so.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar invirtiendo en el trabajo agrícola,en esta ocasión utilizará seis sacos de abono, también herbicidas y pesticidas, él ha tenido un accidente realizando un juego de fútbol, se encontraba divirtiéndose con sus vecinos y amigos cuando se fracturó su mano, la siembra que está realizando en realidad quienes la trabajarán serán sus hermanos y hermanas, pues es una tarea fuerte que actualmente no puede revisar, el préstamo también le dará una parte para poder cubrir algunos cuidados con su mano.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo, expandiendo la capacidad de la siembra, logrando sacar una mejor producción, su aspiración es salir de esta situación que actualmente atraviesa y continuar trabajando con los préstamos de kiva.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to continue investing in agricultural work.  On this occasion he will use six sacks of manure and also herbicides and pesticides.  

He’s had an accident playing soccer.  He was enjoying himself with his friends and neighbors when he fractured his hand.  The new planting he’ll undertake will actually be done by his brothers and sisters because it’s hard work he’s unable to do at present.  Part of the loan will also be used to cover some of the cost of his hand’s treatment.

He got positive results from his previous loan; he expanded crop capacity thus obtaining larger yields.  His hope is to overcome the situation he’s going through at present and to continue working with Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of manure, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru: Лариса разведена, у нее один взрослый ребенок. Лариса тогует хозяйственными товарами и фейерверками на небольшом рынке в г. Запорожье, Украина. Торговлей она занимается давно. Бизнес - единственный источник ее дохода. Помимо рынка, Лариса выезжает с товаром в ближайшие села, чтобы люди могли купить ее товар на месте. Выездная торговля хотя и не легкое дело (приходиться возить товар с собой и носить сумки с товаром в руках), но приносит дополнительный доход. Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара. Бизнес цель Ларисы - получение прибыли и содержание семьи.
texts.en: Larisa is divorced with one grown child. She sells household goods and fireworks at a small market in the city of Zaporozhye, Ukraine. She has worked in commerce for a long time. Her business is her only source of income. In addition to the market, Larisa takes her wares to nearby villages so that people can buy her goods on-site there. Travelling sales is not easy work--she has to carry the goods with her in bags in her arms--but it brings in extra income. Larisa is asking to be granted a loan to expand her range of goods. Larisa's business goal is to make profit and support her family.

loans.use: expand her range of goods.

loans.name: Cristina Marilyn

texts.es:
Cristina Marilyn tiene 30 años de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo de dos años, vive con el compañero y el hijo en Ventans provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Cristina Marilyn se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas, insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas el cogollero, ratón en los cultivos.

 El sueño es tener pollos para criarlos y poder verderlos aún buen precio.
texts.en:
Cristina Marilyn, 30, is in a civil union and has a two-year-old son; she lives with her spouse and son in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) communal bank located in Recinto Cachely Grande that’s part of Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved with short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

Cristina Marilyn grows corn and also raises chickens.  Her purchases and her sales of agricultural products take place in Ventanas.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, weed killers and supplies.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops.  She faces challenges like various kinds of plant infestations.  Her dream is to have chicks to raise and sell at a good price.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Edneyda Virginia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chocolates,tortas y pasteles,ella trabaja para contratos de matrimonios,cumpleaños y bautizos,la socia ya tiene 3 años en este negocio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los chocolates,tortas y pasteles.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos como harina,chocolates,mantequilla y azucar.

La socia se siente feliz por el credito y se compromete a pagar en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower still has her business selling chocolates, cakes and pastries. She does contract work for weddings, birthdays and baptisms. She already has three years in this business, and works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m. 

By means of this business, the borrower wants to move forward in life. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell chocolates, cakes, and pastries. The borrower is requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, chocolate, butter and sugar. 

She is happy about the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, chocolate, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Wilbert Isaias

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo de movilidad escolar,el tiene una combi donde hace servicio de mobilidad,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m y la socia ya tiene 6 años en este trabajo,por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito apara comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio  está contento con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
This member is still working in school transportation. He has a van he uses for transportation. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.and has been doing this job for 6 years. With this job, he wants to get his children ahead. His dream is to buy a new car. He has asked for the loan to buy tires for his car.

He is happy with the loan he has been given and grateful to the  Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Shomahmad

texts.ru:
Шомахмад проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 23 года. Он холост. Шомахмад живет с родителями. Его отец находится на заработках за рубежом. 
Шомахмад имеет среднее образование. Он на протяжении трех лет занимается животноводством. Шомахмад в основном занимается купле – продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он просит кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Shomahmad lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 23 years old, single and lives with his parents.  His father is working abroad.  Shomahmad has a secondary education.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years.  Shomahmad primarily buys and sells cattle.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medicine, doctors' appointments and medical exams.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra Norma es madre soltera tiene 1 hija  que aun están en la escuela primaria, ella trabaja diariamente para poder cumplir el rol de padre y madre para su hija.
Ella montó una despensa en su casa que esta ubicada en un barrio muy poblado de la zona. La señora es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe dudas que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Con el crédito desea comprar mas mercaderías como lácteos, carnes, gaseosas, entre otras para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is a single mother of one daughter who is still in primary school. She works every day to be bale to fill the role of father and mother for her daugter.

She opened a store in her house, which is located in a very populated neighborhood in the area. She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead. She has a jovial and entrepreneurial spirit and there is no doubt that she will meet all of the goals she has set for herself.

With the loan, she wants to buy more merchandise such as dairy products, meat, soft drinks and more to offer her customers more variety.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as dairy products, soft drinks and meat.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: El Sr. Segundo tiene 46 años de edad,  está casado, tiene dos hijos, y vive en el municipio de Arizona Atlántida. Don segundo tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de muebles de madera como ser: puertas, marcos para puertas, ventanas, closet, muebles de comedor y otros. Utiliza madera no tradicional y de color para elaborar muebles finos. El préstamo que solicita es el tercero con ODEF y es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar un lote de madera para terminar unos trabajos pendientes que tiene y mantener siempre madera disponible en su taller. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio y obtener ingresos para su bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Segundo, 46, is married and has two children.  He lives in the town of Arizona, Atlántida.  Segundo has been manufacturing wood furniture like doors, door frames, windows, closets, dining room furniture and others for four years.  He uses traditional and colored woods to manufacture fine furniture.  

The loan he’s requesting from ODEF is his third one and it’s for 15,000 lempiras that he will use to buy a load of lumber to finish some pending jobs he has and to have lumber on hand always in his workshop.  His goal is to grow more in business and to earn income for his personal wellbeing as well as for his family’s.

loans.use: to buy lumber to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité San Antonio esta conformado por 16 mujeres que se dedican a distintas actividades de acuerdo a las posibilidades de casa una, esmerándose dentro de sus aptitudes para sacar adelantes a sus respectivas familias.
La señora Laura tiene 2 hijos y montó su propia despensa pequeña donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar y también lo necesario para la limpieza e higiene personal. La señora Laura cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos para el emprendimiento por ello espera que el negocio crezca y se vuelva cada vez mas competitivo en los precios y en la calidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como lácteos, panificados, bebidas, frutas, hortalizas, etc.
texts.en:
The San Antonio communal bank is made up of 16 women, who do various kinds of work according to the means of each. With the skills they have, they are doing their best to raise their respective families. 

Laura has two children and has set up her own small grocery store, where she sells basic household products and also necessary items for cleaning and personal hygiene. 

For this undertaking, Laura has the help of her two children, so she hopes the business grows and becomes increasingly competitive in terms of price and quality. 

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as dairy products, baked goods, drinks, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: To buy dairy products, baked goods, meats and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras Kuña Katupyry tiene un total de 14 miembros, se encuentra en su 6° ciclo; las miembros se benefician del crédito con el fin de invertir en sus respectivas actividades, y continuar con sus labores en post de un futuro mejor.
La señora Lucila es macatera  por lo tanto tiene un trabajo diario que lo realiza de forma ambulante acompañada de sus hijas. 
El crédito lo utilizará para poder salir adelante ella y sus hijas, también invertiría en la compra de sábanas, carteras, escobas, ollas, etc.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras Kuña Katupyry” committee has 14 members.  It’s in its 6th cycle.  The members will use the loan to invest in their various activities and continue working in search of a better future.

Lucila is a street merchant; she has daily work she does from place to place in the company of her daughters.  She will use the loan in order to her and her daughters to get ahead.  She will also buy sheets, purses, brooms, pots, etc.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, brooms, pots, etc.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael tiene 43 años es casado tiene 2 hijos y viven en es casa propia.
El señor es macatero hace mas de 10 años, con la ayuda de su esposa sale todos los días a vender su producto para poder mantener a su familia. Su trabajo es muy cansador ya que tiene que recorrer casa por casa para realizar las ventas. Actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela fija que conoce de la calidad y buen precio del señor, igualmente el nos cuenta que con entusiasmo y optimismo en una venta mayor diaria el no pierde la esperanza y sale a vender pensando en un futuro mejor.
El crédito serviría para comprar mercaderías como sábanas,cubre camas, zapatos, entre otros.
texts.en: Ismael, 43, is married and has two children; they live in his own house.  He has been a street merchant for more than ten years.  With his wife’s help he heads out every day to sell his products in order to support his family.  His work is very demanding because he has to go house to house to make sales.  He currently has a regular clientele that knows the quality and good prices he has.  He also comments that he goes out every day with enthusiasm and optimism that he’ll make big sales; he doesn’t lose hope and goes out to sell thinking of a better future.  The loan will be used to buy merchandise like sheets, bedspreads and shoes, among others.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe, Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past ten years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells mattresses. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more mattresses and blankets, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and help her live a better life. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to start a wholesale mattress shop. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses and blankets.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is a 43-year-old businessman. He is married to Peninah who is a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been selling cereals for the past fifteen years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Celeste will use the loan to buy more stock of cereals for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open another cereals shop and improve the family standard.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: La joven Maria Estela de 29 años de edad, casada, se dedica a comercializar nacatamales, hielo y refrescos  desde hace 4 años, es originaria de la capital Managua, a sus 25 años inicio con una venta de chicha una bebida típica del país hecha a base de maíz dulce. Luego  vendió comida después empezó con los nacatamales otros refrescos y hielo que actualmente  este es su negocio, los sábados y domingos vende hot-Dog y sándwich. Para la elaboración de los nacatamales le ayudan las mujeres de su familia. Vende su producto en su casa de habitación y en un colegio donde le vende comida a los profesores, su esposo le ayuda económicamente ya que el trabaja vendiendo ropa. A Maria Estela le gustaría ubicar su producto en otro local a parte del de su domicilio ya que  las expectativas que tiene es expandir su negocio, reproducir las ventas y acondicionar el local en el que ella vende su producto. Por este motivo ella solicita un préstamo kiva para poder comprar una mantenedora con el objetivo de vender mas productos refrigerados y asi ofrecer diversidad  de productos a sus clientes. Maria opina que la oportunidad que le ofrece este crédito  será de éxito para ella ya que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas a través de más productos y económicamente mejorara su nivel de vida. Una de sus metas próximas es seguir incrementando sus clientes e invertir en un nuevo negocio como es vender ropa y tratar de esforzarse más y poner su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
María Estela, 29, is a young married woman.  She’s been selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales], ice and soft-drinks for the last four years.  She’s from the capital, Managua.  At the age of 25 she started selling chicha, a traditional beverage made from sweet corn.  Then she started selling food and after that nacatamales, soft-drinks and ice which is her current business.  On Saturdays and Sundays she sells hot-dogs and sandwiches.
