texts.es:
Roberto, vive con sus padres, un hermano, está soltero y no tiene hijos, administra una tienda de productos básicos, este negocio le ha ayudado a generar ingresos para el hogar, se inició con su padre quien se lo ha heredado para que continúe invirtiendo y desarrollandolo en la comunidad.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la mejora del local, ya que cuenta con un equipo (vitrinas) antiguo que quiere mejorar, el préstamo le dará los recursos económicos para que logre realizar la modernización en el negocio atraer con nueva imagen a nuevos clientes.

Su objetivo es crecer en mercadería para instalar un minisúper, pues su sueño es ampliarse en el comercio.
texts.en:
Roberto lives with his parents and one brother, and is single without any children. He runs a store that sells basic products and this business has helped him generate income for his household. It began with his father from whom it was inherited so that he continues investing and developing it in the community.

He is requesting a loan to invest in improvements for the shop as it has old equipment (display cabinet) that he wants to upgrade. The loan will provide him with financial resources so that he can manage to carry out the business' modernization and attract new clients with a new image.

His objective is to increase merchandise in order to install a mini supermarket; thus his dream is to grow in business.

loans.use: to buy new display cabinets.

loans.name: Sara Cecilia

texts.es:
Sara, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, como el abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, que son necesarios para aplicarlos y poder prevenir las plagas al cultivo.
Con el préstamo anterior, tuvo un efecto positivo ya que le ayudo a mejorar la producción en los cultivos, del cual logro realizar ventas y genero ingresos para su familia, también hoy día cuenta con un vehículo para transportar la producción.
texts.en:
Sara is requesting a new loan to purchase farming materials like fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides, which are necessary to apply and to be able to prevent pests on the crops.

The previous loan had a positive effect since it helped her improve crop production. From this she managed to carry out sales and she generated income for her family. Also, these days she has a vehicle with which to transport her production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El Sr Leoncio tiene 45 años, es comerciante hace más de 15 años. Está casado con la Sra. Anastasia Villaverde hace mas de 20 años de los cuales tienen tres hijos.
Su señora tiene una pequeña despensa con la que también aporta un ingreso a la canasta familiar, ambos se ayudan mutuamente por salir adelante y poder tener un presente y futuro mejor como familia que son.
El señor solicita el crédito para comprar una hidrolavadora.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 45 years old and has been a businessman for more than 15 years. He and his wife, Anastasia Villaverde, have been married for over 20 years and together they have 3 children. His wife has a small shop that allows her to also contribute to the family income.

Leoncio and his wife mutually help each other to get ahead and to be able to have a better present and future as a family. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase a washing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, quiere seguir cultivando y también mejorar algunas cosas a su vehículo, este préstamo será muy importante porque cubrirá varias necesidades, comprándose abono, herbicidas, para aplicarlos al cultivo, también llantas, bujías y mantenimiento al vehículo. 
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que su inversión le ha dado resultados positivos, en su familia se encuentran bien, siempre está trabajando la agricultura para mejorar siempre la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro wants to keep farming and also improve some things to his vehicle. This loan will be very important because will cover various needs. He will buy fertilizer and herbicides for the crops. Also, he will buy tires and spark plugs for the maintenance of his vehicle.

The previous loan had a positive effect, because his investment yielded to positive results. His family is doing well. He is always working in agriculture, to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, tires and spark plugs for the vehicle

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
El socio Florencio  pertenece  al banco comunal “Manos Juntas” y el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Florencio tiene 65 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene 2 hijos, el socio es natural de la provincia de La Convención departamento del Cusco pero vive en la encantadora ciudad de Cusco. El socio Florencio tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes turísticos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar este servicio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad el socio Florencio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros o sea va comprar repuestos.   

El socio Florencio agradece a quienes forman parte de  este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Florencio belongs to the communal bank "Manos Juntas". The banks is located in the district of Cuso, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

The member Florencio is 65 years old, is married and fruit of this beautiful relationship, he has 2 children. The member is from the province of La Convención, department of Cusco but lives in the lovely city of Cusco.

The member Florencio has a small travel agency for tourists. He has been providing this service for several years and he is doing very well. This time, the member Florencio needs a loan for the maintenance of his cars; he is going to buy spare parts. 

The member Florencio thanks to those who are part of this dream. He compromises to comply with the installment payments on time.

loans.use: to do the maintenance of his cars, he will buy spare parts

loans.name: “Takku Liggey Kahone” Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes membres du groupe "Takku liggey kahone” exercent un commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques.Elles achètent épargnent chaque semaine dans leur compte ouvert à l'UIMCEC. Elles achètent leurs produits en gros pour amoindrir les frais.Elles se partagent ensuite les produits en fonction de l'apport de chacune.Ce commerce leur rapporte des revenus assez inintéressants qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins et à certaines dépenses d'entretien de leurs enfants.Le chef du groupe (qui tient les documents) est nouvellement mariée.Elles vend des parfums, du savon et d'autres produits divers de cosmétiques.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des produits de cosmétiques.Leur ambition est de construire des cantines au marché central.
texts.en:
The 5 female members of the group "Takku liggey kahone” sell fabrics and beauty products. They save money each week to their shared account at UIMCEC. They buy their products wholesale to save costs. They then share the products amongst themselves according to how much each member has contributed. This business generates a fairly decent income which enables them to meet their needs and cover some of their children's living expenses. 

The group's leader (who is holding the documents) is just married. She sells perfumes, soaps and various other beauty products. 

In order to strengthen their businesses, they are requesting a loan of 500 000 francs so that they can buy beauty products. Their ambition is to build small stores in the central market.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian is in his fifties, married and has two children, both are school-aged children. They all live in the southeast part of Albania. For the past twelve something years, Adrian has been running his own restaurant café & bar. He has been the only one to provide financially for himself and his family, and it hasn’t been easy at all for him and everyone else in the family living on a very tight budget.
 
Adrian is applying for a loan now to stock up on inventory items for his restaurant because many local people who had immigrated to Greece during the past years have come back due to the economic crisis in that country, with the hope of establishing a life in their homeland this time. And this increased the number of visitors to his place and of course the demand for more services.

Adrian is appreciative to all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for his restaurant cafe & bar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new products (toiletries) for resale.

loans.name: 010111- Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khuyên operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to to purchase fish for resell .

Khuyên is 36 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 010111- Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Khuyên supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2002, Khuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Khuyên has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Khuyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Khuyên faces in her business is the lack of labor help.

With her business profit, Khuyên hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resell

loans.name: 02.05.02 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sâm has a business catching fish.  Sâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fishing-net to catch fish. 

Sâm is 57 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. Another child is grown up. Sâm is the group leader of the 02.05.02 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of six members.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.In 2006, Sâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Sâm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Sâm hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fishing-net to catch fish.

loans.name: Tabingin

texts.en:
Tabingin works as a laborer on a rubber plantation, with a very minimal income. Tabingin has three children. With his uncertain income, Tabingin worries about his children's education, especially that of Luthfiani.He has applied for a loan through Kiva's student loan program to help Luthfiani finish school. In the picture,Tabingin, Yanti his wife and Luthfiani her daughter. 

Luthfiani is a student at a vocational school and lives in a barren area. The family's economic situation is cause for concern, and makes him worried about dropping out of school. Because the parental income is uncertain, this motivates Luthfiani to follow the student loan program of Kiva in order to help ease the burden on her parents.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is 53-year-old woman and accessed a loan in 2003 for the first time. She started the work of hand embroidery through support of Kashf Founadation.  Now she has a complete set up of almost 15 houses which are working under her supervision. She is not making money alone but also providing a source of income for other women who are working for her. She is quite satisfied with the service of Kashf Foundation.   

In order to meet the growing demand for embroidery she needs to engage some more women. Now she has requested a loan of Rs.30,000/- from Kashf Foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more frames, needles and thread of different colors which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more frames, needles and thread of different colors

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en: Three years ago, Lubna started a beauty parlor in a small corner of her two-room house. She, along with her mother, work hard day and night to make the beauty parlor famous so they can provide for her family. She did not get married due to lack of money for a wedding. Both Lubna and her mother labor tirelessly to keep the business running because they are the bread winners of the house. There are six people depending on these two women since none of Lubna’s siblings are old enough to earn an income themselves. Two of her sisters go to school. They told Kashf that it was getting extremely difficult to manage the family as the parlor was running on minimum necessities and clients were hesitant to use the services. That’s when she took a loan of RS 30,000 from Kashf and reported that she will be investing in utensils, cosmetics and some furniture for the parlor.

loans.use: To purchase utensils, cosmetics and some furniture for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widow living in Tukuran. She is 57 years old with two children. Erlinda owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Erlinda joined GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to be able to develop her farm further.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Renar

texts.en: Renar, a 32-year-old, is a married entrepreneur from Cagay-ayon, Jimenez. He has one child and is earning from his purchases and sales of his fruits and vegetables business. The business started almost three years ago now and he earns PHP 4,500 a month. To improve his business, he borrows the amount of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC micro-credit that he joined in 2007 to obtain more fruits and vegetables to sell. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility to expand his business.

loans.use: to obtain more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Saliman

texts.en:
Saliman works as a laborer, earning U.S. $ 40 per month. The first child of Saliman, Sri, wants to be able to continue school to better her future. Saliman wants to apply for a loan from the Kiva program, to be able to finance the vocational school for Sri. In the picture, Saliman, Tarminah, his wife and Sri, his daughter.

Sri wants to be a public accountant to help ease the burden on her parents and so that younger siblings can attend school. Sri's parents are quite old, and a loan from Kiva will be able to offset the cost of vocational schools. Sri expects a quick finish to school and to get a job soon.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy leather and other materials for a shoe-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, shovels, chemicals, and gloves.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 59 years old and is married with five children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

She has been farming vegetable for three years, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Juanita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juanita works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 47 years old and married with two children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a tobacco sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more tobacco to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ambulant vending tobacco business for 19 years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more tobacco to sell

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 59 years old and widow with 2 children. Eulalia works very hard to provide for them.

Eulalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Eulalia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Eulalia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood to resell

loans.name: Atinen

texts.en:
Atinen is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married and has 2 children.  Atinen  is a worker in a bakery and his wife manages their sari-sari store, which sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages.  They have had this business for 4  years.  

Atinen requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.   Atinen has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: restock his variety store

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata est une femme qui exerce un commerce de produits cosmétiques.Elle achète et revend des méches, des parfums et d'autres produits divers.Ce commerce génère des bénéfices qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge ainsi que certains besoins de membres de sa famille.Elle sollicite un pret de 500000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en acheter des mèches et des produits divers de  cosmétiques.Son ambition est d'élargir son commerce.
texts.en: Aminata has a business selling beauty products. She buys and sells hair extensions, perfumes and various other products. This business generates profits which enable her to be self-sufficient and to take care of some of her family members' needs. She is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs in order to strengthen her business by buying hair extensions and various beauty products. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and various beauty products.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Moustapha est un agriculteur.Il possède des hectares de terre qu'il exploite avec des spéculations comme l'arachide et le mil.Il utilise la production pour la consommation de la famille.Une partie de cette production est toutefois vendue et lui permet d'obtenir des revenus pour subvenir à certains besoins de cette meme famille.Afin de renforcer son activité , il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des engrais et de l'urée.
texts.en: Moustapha is a farmer. He owns several hectares of land which he cultivates with crops like groundnuts and millet. He uses the produce to feed his family. However, he also sells a part of the produce, which allows him to earn an income so that he can meet certain of his family's needs. He is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs with which to buy fertilizer and urea, so that he can strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and urea.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes and other used items for sale.

loans.name: Gpf Keur Moussa Frontière Group

texts.fr: Le groupement de promotion féminine (Gpf keur moussa frontière) est un groupe de solidarité de cinq femmes qui s'activent dans l'agriculture. Elles cultivent des légumes et de l'arachide.Les légumes sont pour la consommation familiale alors que l'arachide est destinée à la vente.Ceci leur procure des revenus pour prendre en charge certaines dépenses d'entretien de leurs enfants ainsi que leurs propres besoins.Afin de renforcer leur production, elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
texts.en: The Gpf Keur Moussa Frontière female promotion group has five female members, all of whom work in agriculture. They grow vegetables and peanuts – the vegetables for family consumption, and the peanuts for sale. This gives them income to cover certain expenses involved in bringing up their children, as well as providing for themselves. To expand their production, they have requested a loan of 500,000 francs to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gpf Darou Sahette Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Gpf darou sahette" se compose de cinq femmes qui pratiquent toutes l'agriculture.Elles cultivent chacune un champ d'arachide qui leur permette de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles.Elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter de l'engrais et des semences.
texts.en: The Gpf Darou Sahette group has five female members, all of whom work in agriculture. They each grow a peanut field, which allows them to provide for their families. They have requested a loan of 500,000 francs to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.fr: Josine est jeune femme âgée de 30 ans, fiancée et mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 7 et 12 ans tous scolarisés ayant 3 autres personnes à sa charcge.Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale où elle exerce son activité depuis 1an.Sa gentillesse et sa sociabilité ont fait d' elle une commerçante incontournable dans son domaine d'activité.Voulant étendre et diversifierson activité,elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d' augmenter les stocks de marchandises,d'épargner et surtout de continuer de s'occuper de sa nombreuse famille.
texts.en:
Josiane is a young, 30-year-old woman, who is engaged to be married. She is mother to five children aged between 7 and 12, all of whom are at school, and also has three other people under her care. She works as a retailer in a neighborhood of the capital, and has been involved in this business for a year.

Josiane’s kindness and sociable nature make her stand out in her area of business. As she wants to expand and diversify her business, she has requested a loan. This will allow her to increase her stock, save, and above all continue to look after her large family.

loans.use: To buy call credit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy leather for shoemaking

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy artificial jewelry material

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Шахло проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ей 35 лет. У нее двое детей. Шахло живет с родителями. Она предоставляет услугу. Шахло портниха, она уже три года занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она принимает заказы на дому. 
Шахло берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en:
Shahlo is a 35-year-old woman living in the Qumsangir region. She has two children and lives with her parents. 

Shahlo works in the service industry as a dressmaker. She has been sewing dresses in the Tajik national style for eight years now. She takes orders from home. She would like to get this loan in order to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
La señora Alba de 45 años de edad, es madre soltera tuvo tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos dependen de ella y actualmente renta la casa donde ella vive, radica en la comunidad de san Lorenzo, Honduras, se dedica desde hace 21 años al negocio de venta de pan y rosquillas en el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo, todo los días de lunes a sábado viaja para poder vender sus productos, sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos que a diario visitan su puesto de venta.
Doña Alba esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar mil bloques, leña, harina, maíz, y cuajada. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende comenzar a construir su propia casa ya que con las ganancias desea seguir trabajando he invirtiendo en su proyecto.
Doña Alba su deseo es tener su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Alba is 45 years old. She is a single mother of three children. Two of them depend on her. The house she is living in is rented. She lives in the community of  San Lorenzo, Honduras. For 21 years she has worked in the business of selling bread and rolls in the old market of San Lorenzo. Every day. Monday through Saturday, she traveles to be able to sell her products. Her customers are friends and neighbors who visit her sales spot daily. 

Alba is asking for a loan to buy a thousand blocks, firewood, flour, corn and cheese curds. With the support of this loan, she intends on beginning to build her own home since with the earnings she wants to keep working and investing in her project.

Alba's wish is o own her own home. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2012.

loans.use: to buy 1000 blocks, firewood, flour, corn and cheese curds for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for grocery shop business

loans.name: Reyna Maribel

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a la venta de carne de res, vive en casa propia con su esposo y dos hijas de 18 y 13 años de edad, este negocio lo realiza hace 10 años, lo aprendió de una tía, hasta el momento le ha permitido mantener todo lo necesario su hogar a través de las utilidades que ha logrado generar.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de carne de res y chorizo, ya que esto le permitirá aumentar la disponibilidad en el negocio y tener para los clientes, su objetivo es mejorar el negocio y mejorar los ingresos a través de los préstamos.

Su aspiración futura, es comprarse un vehículo propio donde pueda trasladar la carne, también podría tener un negocio más rentable, procurar una mejor calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Reina sells beef and lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters ages 18 and 13. She has had this business for 10 years, having learnt it from an aunt and up until now it has allowed her to maintain everything she has needed for her home through her business activities.

Reina requests a loan in order to purchase beef and chorizo as this will allow her to increase the availability of her stock for her clients and her objective is to improve her business and her income through this loan.

In future she plans to purchase her own vehicle to transport the meat, also to have a more profitable business and to find a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: purchase beef and chorizo to increase the stock for her clients

loans.name: Esmeralda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Esmeralda, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de insumos para la crianza de pollos de engorde y continuar en la comercialización, se comprara concentrado, granza y vitaminas, esto le dará la oportunidad de continuar trabajando y produciendo ganancias.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener más pollos de engorde,  también en este periodo logro tener más clientes para la comercialización, todo este avance a mejorado su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is requesting a new loan to buy supplies for raising broiler chickens and selling them. She will buy feed, bedding materials, and vitamins, which will allow her to keep working and earning money.
She used the previous loan to purchase more broiler chickens. She also gained more customers, which has helped her improve her circumstances.

loans.use: to buy feed, bedding materials, and vitamins.

loans.name: La Fe 5, 6, 8 Group

texts.en:
Dilcia is a member of the group called La Fe (Faith) 5, 6, & 8. This group is located in the city of Samana, in a rural community surrounded by mountains and the Atlantic Ocean. These fifteen entrepreneurs are running their businesses in their community or in other communities nearby.

Dilcia makes her home here in a simple house with her husband and their two children. She sells cosmetics and beauty products, and she wants to use this loan to increase her business inventory. In the future, she wants to continue working so she can overcome the difficulties in her life. By working hard in her business and with the help of 9 previous loans, it has been possible for Dilcia to grow her business and expand her clientele. Dilcia told us that she is working hard because she wants to have a successful business and to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Miguel Hernan

texts.es:
Miguel Herman tiene 36 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos , en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es aumentar la produccion.

Le gusta hacer deporte con la familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Hernan is 36 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the village of Ventanas in Los Ríos province.
The members of the Ciudadela Los Angeles village bank meet in the Angeles neighborhood in Ventanas. They make a living cultivating corn and rice.
Miguel is a corn and rice farmer. He buys supplies in Comercial Procan and sells his harvests at the Ventanas market.
He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies and fertilizer for his crops. The loan will help him finance his needs. His dream is to increase his crop yield.
He likes to play sports with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Martha Mercedes

texts.es:
Martha Mercedes tiene 43 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con un hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Martha se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener mas ingresos para darle al hijo todo lo necesario.

Le gusta estar con la familia y descanzar.
texts.en:
Martha Mercedes is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son in the village of Ventanas in Los Ríos province.

The members of the Ciudadela Los Angeles village bank meet in the Angeles neighborhood in Ventanas. They make a living cultivating corn and rice.

Martha is a corn and rice farmer. She buys supplies in Comercial Procan and sells her harvests at the Ventanas market.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan will help her finance her needs. Her dream is to increase her income so she can give her son everything he needs.

She likes spending time with her family and relaxing.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda has been an active member of PMPC since 2010.  She is married with 4 adult-age children.  Leonarda makes rice cakes, which earns her a monthly average of Php 2,500.  She took a loan from PMPC in the amount of Php 3,000 so that she can purchase additional raw materials to make more rice cakes. She wants to use the profit to increase her household income and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for rice cakes.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 37 years old. She is a single mom with one child. She has had a sari-sari store (convenience store) business for 10 years. She decided to join PMPC this year so she would have access to financial support for her business. She took a loan in PMPC in the amount of Php 6,000 to purchase additional soft drinks for sale. She hopes that through her hard work she can provide quality education for her kid.

loans.use: to purchase addtional soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Saroeurn, 38 years old and a citizen from the Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap province, is working as a construction worker in order to support her family. She has five children, two of whom still need her support,  one works at the construction site for a low salary and the other one is a student. She also raises chickens at home to generate extra income.  She has been in this business for 2 years and can earn about 12,000 KHR per day. 
This is her first loan cycle for Saroeurn's group, consisting of three female members.  They are requesting 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the group leader, she will use her loan to build a decent toilet for her family.  She hopes to own a proper toilet to promote good hygiene, especially for her children.

loans.use: To build a decent toilet for her family

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and buy old clothes for her thread-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To rent a garden in which to grow fruit and to purchase a cycle for selling fruits on the street.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy masonry tools.

loans.name: Marinie

texts.en:
Marinie is a new member of PMPC. She is 30 years old and married with two school-age children.  

Marinie has operated a sari-sari (convenience) store business for three years. She earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. She decided to join PMPC to have financial access to support her business in terms of capital generation. She will use the loan to purchase additional grocery stock for her store.  

Marinie is planning to use the profits to support the educational needs of her children and provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for resale.

loans.name: Betchie Pearl

texts.en:
Betchie Pearl is 24 years old, single, and a resident of North Poblacion, Siquijor, on Siquijor island in the Philippines. She has run a sari-sari general store located in a public market for a period of three years. 

Betchie Pearl joined PMPC in March 2012 so that she could access finances to support her business. She has applied for another loan to purchase more grocery stocks to offer to her customers. She is planning to save the profit for her future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Ana Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para continuar en la venta de las pupusas, por ejemplo invertirá en tomates, repollo, chiles, quesillo, chicharrones, condimentos, ella considera que a través de estos financiamientos ha podido mejorar sus ingresos, porque sus ventas han sido mejor.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ha beneficiado en el negocio, porque ha crecido en la producción, considera estar superándose en su economía familiar y sin inconvenientes hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a loan to buy ingredients in order to continue selling 'pupusas' [a traditional Salvadoran dish made of thick, hand-made corn tortilla filled with a blend of cheese, vegetables or meat].  She will buy things like tomatoes, cabbage, chilies, soft cheese, ‘chicharrones’ [fried pork rinds], and condiments.

She feels that through the loans she has been able to improve her income because her sales have been better.

She says that the previous loan has benefitted her business because production has grown.  She feels that so far her family is improving financially without difficulties.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, chilies, soft cheese, ‘chicharrones’ [fried pork rinds], and condiments.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio es casado tiene 3 hijos y se dedica a ser chofer particular.
Tiene además con su señora un negocio en su domicilio donde venden todo tipo de mercaderías desde artículos de costura, hasta prendas ya fabricadas; con esta actividad ellos logran mantener a su familia aunque quisieran aumentar el ingreso económico.
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar mercaderías, específicamente un lote de calzados que prentende venderlos para generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio is married and has 3 children. He is a private driver. With his wife, he also has a business in his home where they sell all types of merchandise from sewing items to already made clothes. With this activity they are able to support their family, although they would like to increase their income.
The loan he has asked for will be to buy merchandise, specifically a lot of shoes thta he intends to sell to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a new member of microfinance organization PMPC. She is 56 years old, married, and has four children. 

To make a living, Francisca buys coconut shells that she processes into charcoal, which she sells. She's been operated this business for eight months and has a monthly income of 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She is taking a loan through PMPC in order to buy more coconut shells and produce more charcoal, hoping to improve the living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for her charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Celia Maria

texts.es:
Celia Maria tiene 36 años de estado civil Union Libre vive el compañero y con los hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Celia Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz, fréjol gandul, además se dedica a la crianza de animales cómo pollos y cerdos. Compra los productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicita para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes, semillas para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el beneficio de la familia. El sueño es comprar más terrenos para lo hijos y tener una mejor superación para los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho leeer la biblia.
texts.en:
Celia Maria is 36 years old and in a common law marriage. She lives with her companion and thier children. She lives in the Ventanas canton in the provin ce of Los Ríos.

The 14 DE DICIEMBRE communal bank is made up of 15 members of the San José cooperative. It is located in the community of  San Vicente de las Lomas, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. They work in agriculture, such as planting corn.

Celia Maria works in farming. She plants corn, gandul beans, and raising animals such as chickens and pigs. She buys materials in Ventanas and sells her products in the market of the same place and in the markets in the surrounding areas.

She is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, urea, liquid fertilizer, and seeds to plant corn. The loan has helped her to increase her income for her family's benefit. Her dream is to buy more land for her children and have more yields in her crops.

In her free time, she really likes to read the bible.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, liquid fertilizer, and seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Edgar Leonel

texts.es:
Edgar Leonel tiene 23 años de estado civil Union Libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Edgar Leonel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Compra y vende los productos en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas, abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para comprar lo necesario para que los cultivos esten en buenas condiciones. El sueño es comprar una finca para futuro de los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte en especial el indor.
texts.en:
Edgar Leonel, 23, lives in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios with his wife and children.

The 14 DE DICIEMBRE community bank, associated with the San Jose cooperative, has 15 members and is located in San Vicente de las Lomas, a rural town in Ventanas canton.  Its members make their living from farming businesses growing, for example, maize.

Edgar Leonel grows maize and rice.  He also raises pigs.  He buys supplies and sells what he produces in Ventanas.  

He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--seeds, manure, urea, fertilizers, etc.--for growing maize.  The investment will help him buy everything he needs to ensure a good yield.  For the future, he wants to buy a farm that will allow him to better provide for his children.

Edgar Leonel likes to play sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Karina Dinora

texts.es:
Karina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio y así dinamizar el movimiento del inventario, ella necesita comprarse productos frescos como el pescado, camarones, langostas, también verduras frescas, ya que atiende dos negocios en el mismo lugar, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo en sus ventas, ya que aumentó su inventario y mercadería fresca, en su familia su condición se mantiene, ella está motivada con el negocio ya que cuenta con la disponibilidad del recurso a través de estos préstamos para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Karina is requesting a new loan in order to be able to invest in her business.  This way she will invigorate the movement of her inventory.  She needs to buy fresh products like fish, shrimp, and lobster.  She also needs to buy fresh vegetables to offer her customers because she tends two businesses in the same place.

With the previous loan she managed to get a positive result in her sales.  She increased her inventory and fresh merchandise.  Her family condition is stable.  She is motivated in her business because she has the resources available, through these loans, in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, and lobster.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy her son a new sewing machine and pay the shop rent in advance.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 63 years old and married with six adult-age children. She joined PMPC in 2010 because it provides financial access to the poor. 

She's been engaged in raising pigs for more than a year with an average monthly income of 700 Philippines pesos. She took another loan from PMPC to purchase piglets to raise in the backyard. She plans to save the profit in preparation for her old-age life.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Gpf Takku Liggey Keur Babou Ngoné Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe "Gpf takku liggey keur babou ngoné" exploitent un champs collectif d'arachide.Elles cultivent aussi chacune de son côté des légumes et de l'oseille.Cela leur permet d'améliorer les conditions alimentaires de leurs famille.La vente de la production collective leur assure en plus des revenus pour subvenir à certains de leurs  propre besoins et de leurs enfants. Le chef du groupe (avec le carnet, en foulard blanc), est mère de quatre enfants.Elle a en charge leurs dépenses d'habillement et de santé.Aujourd'hui,le groupement sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des semences et de l'engrais afin d'augmenter leur capacité de production.
texts.en:
The 5 women of the "Gpf takku liggey keur babou ngoné" group own a field collectively and farm groundnuts. They also cultivate vegetables and sorrel individually. This enables them to improve their family's food conditions. The sale of their collectively farmed produce ensures extra revenues so that they can meet some of their own needs and those of their children.

The group's leader (holding the notebook and wearing a white scarf) is the mother of 4 children. She is responsible for their clothing expenses and health care.

The group is currently requesting a loan of 500 000 francs with which to buy seeds and fertilizer, so that they can increase their production capacity.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vamos Juntos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite y golosinas, la socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de venta de golosinas ella vendía en un carreta en forma ambulatoria pero debido a su esfuerzo y empeño pudo abrir una tienda de abarrotes la socia se dedico a vende golosinas 15 años pero con sus tienda de abarrotes tiene 2 años, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como azúcar, leche, aceite y golosinas al por mayor para que implemente la tienda de abarrotes.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de carne y negocio de venta de manjares y yogures.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Vamos Juntos” Communal Bank. This bank is located in Cusco District, belongng to Cusco Province in the department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Juana who is married, 47 years old and has two children. She works running her grocery store business where she sells basic supplies such as rice, sugar, milk, oil and sweets. 

Formerly, the member had a business selling sweets and was a street vender, however due to her effort and determination she was able to open a grocery store. The member sold sweets for 15 years but has been running her grocery store for two years. Through this business, the member is helping her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is requesting the loan to purchase products such as sugar, milk, oil and sweets wholesale in order to fully stock her grocery store.

The other members are engaged in the restaurant business, handicrafts, the meat selling business and the business of selling delicacies and yogurt.

The member, Sra. Juana, is grateful to those who form part of fulfilling her dreams by this means and is committed to making all of her payments according to the established timetable.

loans.use: to purchase products such as sugar, milk, oil and sweets wholesale to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Hugo Antonio

texts.es:
Hugo Antonio tiene 47 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y un hijo de 17 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Hugo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como la falta de dinero para pagar a los trabajadores. Su sueño es comprar mas terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta hacer deporte con el hijo.
texts.en:
Hugo Antonio, 47, lives in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios with his wife and 17-year old son.
 
The members of the CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES community bank, in Los Angeles, a rural town in Ventanas canton, make their livings growing farm crops such as maize and rice.
 
Hugo Antonio grows maize and rice. He buys supplies in Comercial Procan and sells what he produces in the wholesale market in Ventanas. 

He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs for growing maize and rice. The investment will help him to continue his farming business.  He faces challenges such as a lack of funds for paying the laborers who help him on the farm.  For the future, he wants to buy more land.
 
In his spare time, Hugo Antonio likes to play sports with his son.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his corn and rice crops.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children, ages 13, 7, 4 and 2. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Roselyn has run a sari-sari store (or convenience store) in their place for more than four years now. She is also in the hog-raising business.

Roselyn is in need of additional capital for her business. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store, such as canned goods, snack food and other grocery items. Moreover, she wants to buy feeds for the pigs.

Roselyn dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more income. With this, she will be able to continually send her children to school to have a good education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store, such as canned goods, snack food and other grocery items.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a hardworking 21-year-old business lady. To earn a living, she sells spare parts in a busy environment with readily available customers. Eunice, being a determined lady, dreams of completing her education in the next five years. She dreams of expanding her business in the future and increasing her sales. Eunice is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy motor vehicle spare parts for sale.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is a 60-year-old woman who runs a sari-sari (or convenience store) at her place in Bohol, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income.

As of this time, Virgincita is in need of additional funds for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as rice, soda, dry goods and other snack foods. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and income.

Virgincita dreams of expanding her business and making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as rice, soda, dry goods and other snack foods.

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.es: Doris, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en una Colonia suburbana de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula junto a sus hijos. Doña Doris tiene un año de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz y venta de frutas. Anteriormente ella vendía comida. Ha sido cliente de seis préstamos con ODEF con los cuales ha podido mantener estable su negocio, actualmente solicita el séptimo préstamo que es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar harina de maíz para elaborar tortillas, leña y con una parte va comprar laminas para reparar su cocina. Su meta es seguir trabajando para mantener activo su negocio y poder brindar una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Doris is 41 years old, and she is a single mother.  She lives with her children in a suburban neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Doris has been making and selling tortillas and selling fruit for one year.  Before that she sold meals.  She has had six loans with ODEF with which she has been able to keep her business stable.

She is currently requesting her seventh loan for 15,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy corn flour to make tortillas, firewood, and metal sheeting to repair her kitchen.

Her goal is to continue working in order to keep her business active and to be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn flour to make tortillas, firewood, and construction materials like metal sheeting to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman and a mother from Bohol, Philippines. She is in the fishing business, since her husband has been a fisherman for more than 10 years now.

Alma is in need of financial assistance for the business. She is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and pay for the repair and maintenance of their fishing boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus augmenting the number of fish she can sell in the market.

Alma dreams of making her business a success so that it can support the needs of the family, especially the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and pay for the repair and maintenance of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, carrots, cucumbers, watermelon, pineapple.

loans.name: Rosa Catalina

texts.es:
Rosa, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería y así continuar trabajando en la venta de tortillas, comprará maíz, leña, gas, que son los materiales que a diario utiliza para la elaboración de su venta, el préstamo le dara facilidad de obtener estos recursos por mayor cantidad y que sus proveedores reduzcan sus precios.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo que le ha ayudado a incrementar las ventas de tortillas y dándole la oportunidad para crecer en el y ganar más clientes, a través de este desarrollo también ha logrado generar mejores ingresos familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies for her tortilla sales business.  She will buy maize, firewood, cooking gas and other supplies that she needs to make tortillas.  The investment will allow her to buy the supplies in bulk at a lower price than she would otherwise have to pay.

A past loan helped Rosa expand her business, pick up new customers and increase her sales.  As her sales have increased, so too the income she makes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Jeffrey A.

texts.en:
A returning client of Accion Texas Inc., Jeffrey applied for a secondary loan to develop a website for his hometown business, NuVision Properties LLC, in Baton Rouge. He began his business in Feb. 2008. Jeffrey describes NuVision as an investment company because, within his business, he takes under-performing apartment complexes and makes them profitable again.  

Jeffrey’s job is to find what the problems are and fix them. He said the majority of the time, a major problem is that a complex owner is new and does not fully understand how to run a business, therefore, tenants may take advantage of the situation. However, Jeffrey is experienced in his field as he previously worked with foreclosed homes.  Jeffrey learned how to successfully make under-performing establishments into profitable places through a combination of self study, a mentor and some trial and error.

The father of three decided to become an entrepreneur to have more time for his family and ability to create his own schedule. Before working with his management company, he worked with an aircraft company in Los Angeles along with an apartment builder who Jeffrey began networking with to learn how the business works. Jeffrey also had a friend who was an established real estate broker and advised him throughout the beginning of his new business.

Currently Jeffrey works alone and has not been able to successfully bid on an establishment so he works with partners who are in charge of placing the cash down payment to secure a bid. When the bid is confirmed, the partner will then receive a percentage of Jeffrey’s profits. Their responsibility is providing the funds. Thereafter, Jeffrey reviews the building, fixes any problems that need to be fixed and offers financial management. “Our partnerships are just to secure a bid. They don’t have to do anything else,” he said. With the help of his partners, Jeffrey manages four buildings. 

The website Jeffrey is in the process of building will list potential properties and make it easier to obtain partners.  It will list new projects and give an overview of what the project entails, and the amount needed to become a part of the partnership. It will be a couple of months until his website goes live, but Jeffrey has secured the site page at www.nuvisionprops.com.

loans.use: to pay for a marketing campaign.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Originally from Chihuahua, Mexico, Raul learned how to work on cars, repair machines, and weld when he was a child and he watched his father, who owned a repair shop. Raul later took courses to enhance his knowledge. Raul followed his father’s path as he moved from Chihuahua to El Paso, Texas and earned American citizenship. 

Taking after him, Raul worked with his father, who began his repair shop in their hometown in 1980. At the beginning of 2001, Raul came to the United States to assist his father at the business. Upon his father’s death, Raul took over the business. 

Currently 44, Raul employs four people. After finding out about Accion Texas Inc. through meeting his loan officer at a business resource meeting, Raul decided to apply for a loan. Upon the approval of a loan from Accion, Raul said he plans to use the funds to purchase materials and equipment, and offer better services for his customers. Without the loan, Raul would have to pay 100 percent upfront for the equipment.  

Just as his father worked all week, Raul continues to keep the shop open Monday through Saturday and to provide for his five children.

loans.use: to purchase tools that will allow him to provide better service for his customers.

loans.name: Gpf Tawa Rip Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes membres du groupement "Gpf tawa rip" exercent l'activité d'agriculture.Elles cultivent des champs individuels d'arachide et de légumes.Elles vendent en fin de saison la récolte pour prendre en charge leurs besoins propres et ceux de leurs enfants.Afin de renforcer la production, elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
texts.en:
The five members of the group "Gpf tawa rip" are farmers. They cultivate individual fields of groundnuts and vegetables. After the harvest, they sell the crops to support themselves and their children. 

To bolster production, they are seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa Edelmira

texts.es:
Rosa, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio, comprando una variedad de perfumería y cosméticos para salir a ofrecer a los clientes, desea adquirir un nuevo pedido con nuevas fragancias, también con lápiz labial, cremas, maquillajes, entre otros productos de belleza que pueden ser demandados por sus clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior ha logrado mejorar su situación económica así ha conquistado nuevos clientes y por lo mismo su demanda ha aumentado, en su familia han logrado adquirir nuevos electrodomésticos para el uso del hogar todo a través de las mejores ganancias que ha percibido.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting a new loan to invest in her business by buying a variety of perfumes and cosmetics so she can offer them to her customers. She wants to place a new order for new fragrances in addition to lipsticks, creams and make-up among other beauty products that may be demanded by her customers.

With the former loan she succeeded in improving her financial situation and attracted new customers so that demand has increased. For her family, she has succeeded in acquiring new appliances for household use through the best earning she has received.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, makeup and creams.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a member of PMPC's micro-finance program. She is 48 years old, married, and has one adult child. She's had a sari-sari (general) store for more than a year, earning 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month. She took out a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items, to generate more income and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 44 years old and single with four school-aged children. She lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor. Susana newly joined PMPC to have financial access to support her business selling ready-to-wear goods. She took a loan from PMPC of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothes, hoping to increase the volume of sales, and of course increase her income, to support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothes for sale

loans.name: Gs La Terminal 3 Group

texts.es:
Doña Edis es un señora muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo, es viuda tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan económicamente.
Doña Edis tiene su negocio en el sur de Honduras. Desde hace mas de 15 años se dedica a Lo que es la venta de ropa nueva.
Doña Edis El préstamo lo necesita Para la compra de ropa nueva como faldas, bóxer, pantalones, ropa interior, ganchos y colas. Este crédito le ayudara ya que tendrá capital fresco para invertir ya que trabaja muy duro para sostener el negocio, también ella da crédito en sus clientes.
Doña Edis sus sueños son de comprar un local para tener mejores ingresos para bienestar de su familia.
Oscar se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la terminal desde hace mas de 13 años y actualmente vive con sus hijos.
Wilfredo se dedica a la fábrica de muebles de madera desde hace mas de 6 años padre de un hijo y actualmente vive con su esposa.

Choluteca, honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Edis works hard to support herself.  She is a widow with 2 grown children, both now living on their own.
Doña Edis operates her clothing sales business in the south of Honduras.  She has operated the business for 15 years and sells new clothing.  
Doña Edis will use this loan to buy skirts, pants, underwear, hangars and other merchandise and supplies.  The investment will provide the capital that she needs to continue her business.
For the future, Doña Edis wants to buy a shop that would allow her to increase her income.
Oscar has operated a snacks business for more than 13 years and lives with his children.  Wilfredo has operated a furniture-making business for 6 years.  He has one child and lives with his wife.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Nexar Octavio

texts.es:
Nexar Octavio tiene 27 años de estado civil Union Libre tiene dos hijos de 7 y 6 meses de edad. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Nexar Octavio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes, ranger y comprar unos pollos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para beneficios de la familia. El sueño es tener comprar una casa.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Nexar Octavio is 27 years old.  He lives in a common-law relationship and has two children, ages 7 and 6 months.  He lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos province.  The “14 de Diciembre” Communal Bank is comprised of fifteen members of the San José cooperative, located in the “San Vicente de Las Lomas” precinct belonging to the Ventanas Canton.  The inhabitants are engaged in agricultural activities such as planting corn.

Nexar Octavio is engaged in farming and plants corn.  He buys his products in Ventanas Canton and sells them at the market, (also located in Ventanas Canton), and fairs in the surrounding area.  He is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer, urea, liquid fertilizers, Ranger (a brand of herbicide), and some chickens.  The loan will help him increase his income to benefit his family. His dream is to buy a house.  In his free time, he enjoys reading the Bible.  
.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, urea, liquid fertilizers, Ranger (a brand of herbicide), and some chickens.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 1

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10. 
Makarimal Akhlakh groupe 1 est un démembrement du GIE.  Il  regroupe  10 personnes qui  fréquentent le meme marché ou ils exercent leurs activités génératrices de revenus de commerce. Ils sont représentés par madame Marame (personne qui est habillée  en rose et qui a la main levée).  C’est une femme mariée qui vit au Sénégal et évolue dans le secteur du commerce, plus précisément dans la vente de tissus et d’habits. Elle pratique aussi la couture. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permet de supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et aussi d’épargner de l’argent dans l’ambition d’acquérir dans le futur c'est-à-dire d’ici trois ans une boutique de commerce en gros.
texts.en:
The Economic Interest Group (EIG) "Gie Makarimal Akhlah" was created on the 10th of October, 2003, in Senegal. The term "Makarimal Akhlah" symbolises someone with a good heart and good practices. The EIG reached a membership number of 300 in 2009. Its objective is to unite its members and allow them to carry out their businesses including: agricultural and halieutic production, general import-export activities, transportation services, industrial activities, craftwork, construction, breeding, mining exploitation, fishing, hydrocarbon exploitation, art and culture, publishing, woodwork, public utility services, representation, processing fish products, farming, spare parts sales, glass-making, baking and the provision of various services. The EIG also aims to consolidate ties of friendship and solidarity between its members, to enable them to acquire the material means and necessary financing to allow them to develop their revenue-generating activities and benefit from all the advantages linked to the EIG. It was with this in mind that a memorandum of understanding was signed between the EIG and UIMCEC to benefit the EIG members at a national level. The first phase was carried out on a sample of 120 active members, divided into 12 groups of 10.

"Makarimal Akhlakh groupe 1" is one of the EIG subgroups. It unites 10 people who go to the same market where they conduct their revenue-generating activities. They are represented by Marame (the woman dressed in pink who has her hand raised). She is married and lives in Senegal and works in retail, selling fabrics and clothing. She also sews. The revenues she earns through her business enables her to cover her children's schooling expenses and also to save money, with the ambition of one day, in about 3 years time, buying a store and becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to resell and to make into clothes for her business.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Alberto pertenece  al banco comunal “Manos Juntas” y el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Alberto tiene 22 años de edad y es soltero y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene 2 hijos, el socio es natural de la provincia de Acomayo del departamento del Cusco pero vive en la encantadora ciudad de Cusco. El socio Alberto  se dedica a la venta y compra de pollo y tiene un pequeño puesto de venta. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad el socio Alberto requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos.  

El socio Alberto  agradece a quienes forman parte de  este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Alberto, belongs to the "Manos Juntas" community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Alberto, 22, is single and has two children.  He was born in Acomayo province and now lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  He has a small stand where he operates his poultry sales business.  He has operated the business for three years and says that it is successful.  Alberto is applying for a loan that he will use to buy chickens.

Alberto is grateful to all of you for helping him work toward his goal and is committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy poultry for his animal sales business.
